Reviews.Title: Product Review to help Fellow Online Purchasers
Reviews.Author: LovingChristian
Reviews.Content: With all the negative comments about this product I wanted to give it a fair chance. I am writing this review because as a fellow online purchaser, product feedback is very important in making your purchase decisions. I almost did not buy this product because of the negative reviews but for $15 I figured it would be worth the risk and now I am glad I bought it. I have made a couple DVDs so far and it has been trial and error but I am getting better each time. This product works and so far is working great. The hardest part is learning to use the software that comes in the package with the Easycap. Just a few steps to get you going... Put the disc in prior to inserting the easy cap. When it autoruns then click on the install driver option. (There are more in depth directions that come with the product but they were in broken English so I'm trying to help with that.) The directions say to tell it not to search the internet then continue on and eventually you will get to a screen that says it has not passed windows logo testing. The directions say to click "continue anyway". Once the drivers are installed then plug in the device. Complete the install new hardware wizard and then it will probably show another device which is the sound and it should install itself. After everything is finished, then on the disc menu click install video studio. Install that and you are ready to go. Plug in your other device (VCR, gaming system, camcorder etc.)Start up the program and click on videostudio editor, it will load up and then click on the capture tab. Then click on the video capture button. (Be patient here this might take a little bit to load stuff in but it won't show it loading it also might mute your system while the sound is integrating.) There is a format line. The default is AVI, I believe, but you will want to set it to MPEG for DVDs and also so you don't take up all of your hard drive (since AVI files are about 1 Gigabyte per minute of video one hour of video would take up a huge chunk of your hard drive. I know this because I used up my entire hard drive on a couple of videos :-)  PLEASE NOTE: there is a little gear that says options. Click it then click "video and audio capture property settings..." MAKE SURE: that under the source tab the TV system says NTSC instead of the default PAL that comes up. IF YOU DO NOT DO THIS YOU MAY NOT SEE ANYTHING COME UP ON THE SCREEN AND MAY NOT BE ABLE TO CAPTURE OR BURN VIDEO ONTO DVD. Also under capture tab I clicked the customize button and put 720 X 480 frame size because if you don't when it burns to DVD it will have to convert it anyways. I also put the speed/quality slider bar all the way over to quality because I'm burning family videos and I could care less how long it takes as long as the quality is best. (Adjust this as you see fit). Next step is to click on capture video and when done click stop capture. You will notice the video is displayed in a little square in the top right corner. You can click this and view it.  When you are done recording and ready to make a disc click the share button at the top and add media as you see fit. You can also edit menus and backgrounds later on. Also notice there are tabs at the bottom left that allow you to change the TV ratio (I use 16:9) and tabs for settings. There is much more to be said about the program but I have not used all the features and this is only to help you get going so you can enjoy your product.  I hope this review has been useful and as I said this is a great product for the price. I have had the product for about a week and I have been working on transferring my family videos to DVD and so far it has been great!

Reviews.Title: This product is great!
Reviews.Author: killerviral
Reviews.Content: This product is great but not perfect it has better quality then a DAzzle but only after i change some settings in the capture area heres how i did it1. click capture video but don't capture.2. click video type.3. click mpeg.4. click options, then click the 'SECOND' option.5. click capture up in the tabs of the options.6. move the quality meter all the way up to 100%.7. then click advance.8. make the quality DVD then scroll to the bottom then click 720 by 620 NTSC or the PAL option right below it if your in Europe.9. the click display area and make it 16.9 then make the bit rate constant bit rate.10. keep the audio were it is expect if the bit rate is under or above 224kbps then make it 224kbps to remove static.11. now download a media encoder because MPEG isn't compatible with alot of programs.13. Now record i bet the quality will be 999999999X better!14. now click this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: Your EasyCAP Could be a Fake
Reviews.Author: Beth66
Reviews.Content: I recently bought one of these and I think I may know why so many people are having issues with getting theirs working. Many of the EasyCAP DC60s being distributed are cheap, poor-quality (and often broken) fakes. I purchased one of these video adapters as a belated birthday present for my son. The item I bought was listed as "new", but when he opened the package, he found that the CD that contained the software for the installation and operation of the adapter was a Mitsubishi brand blank disk with said software burned onto it. My son assumed that I had simply bought him a used EasyCAP, that the previous owner had lost the original CD and that he had burned a replacement CD before selling it back. After installing the software and plugging in the video adapter, my son found that his computer did not recognize that any drivers for the device had been installed. After researching drivers and fixes to the problem, my son eventually found the website of Shenzhen Forward Video, the supposed official manufacturer of the EasyCAP DC60+. Shenzhen Forward Video has given a statement ([...]) claiming that someone has been poorly reproducing and distributing EasyCAP products. In addition to that, it appears as though Shenzhen Forward Video never made an EasyCAP DC60 in the first place; the only model listed on their website with "DC60" in the name is their DC60+, of which production has been discontinued.I am not the only person to have come to the conclusion that they were sold an imitation. During his search for a solution to the drivers problem, my son found a website ([...]) where someone else who had unwittingly bought two broken EasyCAPs and managed to get his hands on a third, working model posted photos comparing the real thing to the reproductions.If you're looking to buy a video adapter, I would suggest that you stay clear of the "EasyCAP" brand altogether because you may not get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: Here is how I got it to work...
Reviews.Author: Yours Truly
Reviews.Content: Hello All:I have a security DVR which gives me direct AVI extracts out of its USB port, but without audio. So my project was to find a way to video capture extracts from the DVR. I bought this EasyCap. Had to make several passes with the WinXP driver install routines until all of EasyCap's drivers installed. Then I installed their video capture software. I was able to get sound but only got fuzz in the video display panel. Then tried Win XPs Movie Maker. Same thing albeit more frustrating. Movie Maker would lock up after each attempt. Next, I went out on a video capture software hunt and tried several other products which had trial downloads. No luck and I was almost at my wits end. My last stop happened to be nchsoftware, who offer the Debut video capture software. And the basic version is free.Unbelieveably, after a little bit of fudging, the video feed from my dvr showed up in the Debut display on my pc. This amazing software lets you record in any of multiple formats: vcd, avi, mp4, etc. There are a couple of quirks, not so huge though. One is that in the 'tools' options to adjust the device I have to keep changing the video input format to NTSC_M each time I launch Debut. Culprit is EasyCap which keeps defaulting to PAL_B. Not sure why PAL_B was chosen as default while marketing to the US. Secondly, while recording I can see the green audio bar moving in the Debut display panel but cannot hear the audio.After I 'stop' the recording session and replay the newly created file from 'recordings' on the menu I have both video and sound in the file.Hope this information will help you too. Saved my day. And I recommend a robust donation to nch software for the free version of Debut. Alternately, buy the Debut Plus to support the company. They have a huge line of other video related products.Hope this info helps you and good luck.AhmedUSA

Reviews.Title: Not worth the effort
Reviews.Author: Brian Ferguson "algermilitia"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item a few months ago because I finally wanted a video capture device to transfer our old home movies to disc, so that we'd have them for much longer than VHS can ever last. Surprise, it didn't work. It wasn't compatible. I decided since it was cheap to buy I'd keep it and wait until I upgraded my computer. I just bought a new laptop setup for multimedia applications and running Windows 7 64bit Home Premium edition. Guess what, the device still doesn't work. It turns out that this particular device is only able to run on XP, Vista, and prossibly Windows 7 32bit edition. It's too bad that when I purchased it, the tech specs didn't say anything about that. Just plug-and-play! Well, that's bull. I searched around the internet for days looking for updated drivers. All that I found were spoof links that downloaded malware, or nothing at all. Unless you have a computer running the specific operating system, don't get this device. I can't even locate a manufacturer, so I can't contact them on getting a driver. Microsoft doesn't have any drivers, and no one will offer support on this device. It's an old model, and they want it gone. So, take my advice, let it collect dust on the maker's shelf, not yours.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and works but lacks support and hard to install
Reviews.Author: Burns Boy
Reviews.Content: I have been a PC support tech for 20+ years.  This device does work, but takes expert knowledge to get the drivers working correctly for both video and audio and to find the correct drivers.  (try googling for "EasyCap DC60 drivers" and read some of the posts to see what I mean)  But I was able to get it working on Windows XP Pro 32bit and it does ok at capturing video using the small capture exes that come with the driver or using "Virtual VCR" which is a nice freeware capture program that can use video codec encoding to reduce the size of the capture files. (works great with the ffshow codec)  However it does not work when trying to capture directly from some larger video packages like "VideoStudio Pro X2" so you have to capture the video using the other capture programs first and then you can import those videos in to the other programs to do the fancy editing.  And believe it or not I was able to get this version of the EasyCap DC60 working on Windows 7 Pro 64bit even though it requires using unofficial drivers. I found them here:  [...]  But it might take some tweaking to get it working correctly.  Your mileage may vary since these are a cheap knock offs and do not seem to be consistent.  So my advice is if you have any doubts you might want to spend the extra money to save the headaches.  To get it working on both OSes took me most of a day searching the net for drivers and tweaking things.  Note it did install the drivers on XP from the CD that came with it just fine, however I only got audio and no video even after ensuring it was set to the correct Composite input and NTSC, etc, (which it defaults to PAL) so I had to find and install other drivers to get it working and to be honest I install so many, I am not sure where I got the ones that finally worked on both video and audio correctly.  All in all I am satisfied for what I was wanting to do with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Mark Hilliker
Reviews.Content: Even though this product was getting some bad feedback from a few individuals, I decided that it would be worth giving it a shot for only about $15.  I had low expectations for this product from the minute I ordered it, even though I looked on YouTube to see how the quality of the video and audio was- and it seemed like pretty okay quality.  To my amazement, the product arrived on time and was in great condition out of the packaging.  By simply adjusting the settings of the provided software and a little bit of editing using Windows Movie Maker, I was able to have HD quality videos.  This was definitely money well spent.  My only complaint is that the provided software will not run correctly using Windows 7; however, the description on the disc says that it is only compatible up to Vista, so try to avoid if your computer is running Windows 7.Other than that, great product, fast shipping, five stars. =)1/9 EDIT:  You CAN run it on Windows 7, but you have to find the drivers for it yourself; it will work fine after that.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, does its job, has useful potential
Reviews.Author: William K. Arthur
Reviews.Content: The Easy Cap video capture works with Windows Vista,but you may have to change the defualt configuration to composite as which its set to tv tuner.By using the included software which is Ulead Video SE you will be able to record whatever is plugged into the composite,svideo.I used an old VCR to transfer my VHSs to my computer which I then edited and burned to DVD. You could also attach camcorders and other video sources like maybe an external tuner or game console just as long as your using composite or svideo.The only thing that I noticed was while previewing and recording there was no sound.But after it was recorded from the source and played the sound was then apparent.Overall, it is less expensive then others and it produces good quality video and Audio.

Reviews.Title: Less expensive, more product
Reviews.Author: Laurie Thelen "Laura"
Reviews.Content: My husband scoffed when I purchased this program, he was all about buying something alot more expensive that had more software. This little gadget is wonderful, I didn't even install the software, only they drivers.I captured the videos to my external hard drive and then made movies with my WinDVD creator...Simple and easy to use, plus it is compact.

Reviews.Title: easy cap dc60
Reviews.Author: Carlton G. Rockwood Jr. "avid fisherman"
Reviews.Content: this is an amazing little inexpensive device. the seller will help you as he did me to work out the technical details i had. im 50 and have trouble with technology. the seller contacted me after i couldnt get it going and provided me with detailed instructions as again im all thumbs. now im uploading my videos of hawks attacking sparrows on my bird feeder and putting it on the web. im very happy with the product and the seller stands behind his product and supports the purchaser far beyond what most people do today. trust this seller. i do. im sure this device does a lot more than what i understand. have awesome videos of sharp shinned hawks attacking sparrows. wonderful.

Reviews.Title: A Challenge, But It Is Working on Vista and XP
Reviews.Author: K. Gibbons "pcnetwrx"
Reviews.Content: It appears that there are several versions of these clones being sold. Some have mentioned that theirs installs as a device STK1150, and someone else said theirs installed as a SM-USB 007 device. Mine installed simply as OEM Capture device on both a Vista laptop and on my XP laptop and desktop. First, my goal was to get a live feed from a camera up on a secondary screen display full-screen (i.e. projector system). I encountered several hurdles along the way, but I did finally figure out how to get it done. First, before letting the device install its drivers, you may want to just stick it in to see if it identifies as OEM Capture like mine did. Then don't install it and just abort and pull it back out. Assuming it is the same as mine was, put in the driver CD and let it autoboot to the menu. Install the driver taking all of the defaults. Then put the device in and let the driver complete its installation. Then you may want to go ahead and install the included Ulead Video Studio SE but note that this software did not work on my Vista laptop. It would run, but I never got an image on it. Instead, download the free VLC Media Player and install that. When I installed it, I unchecked the file associations and the context menu stuff because I did not want it messing with what my media files were associated with. Then I let it complete the installation. Watch out for clone installers that might want to install toolbars and other nonsense. The official download I did, had none of that. Then run the VLC program and click on Media - Open Capture Device. Then click on Advanced Options. Choose OEM Capture for the Video Device Name and put a check in Device Properties. Click on OK and then on Play at the bottom. After a couple of seconds boxes will start to popup where you choose NTSC-M, audio selections (I did not need audio so I did not even experiment with that), and then you can choose Composite Video on the third popup instead of the default S-Video. At that point you should see video from your source. If you drag the window over to your secondary screen and double-click on the image it will go full screen on the secondary display. A lot of other software would only do full screen on the primary display. I have no idea how VLC does with actually capturing files and audio, but it did do what I was going after. The price was fine at $8, but the time investment was unreal at many hours of trying to figure this out. I just hope it helps someone else and that you can share how the recording and audio capabilities are for the devices that register as just OEM Capture.UPDATE: When I finally did get everything connected to the projection system, I found that I had a video delay of nearly one full second, which is not really workable when trying to feed a live shot up onto a screen. It is very disconcerting to hear the sound and then see the lips moving a second later. There may be some instances where the delay would not matter, but if you are trying to do the same thing I was trying to do it may be a lost cause.

Reviews.Title: HARDWARE: VERY GOOD; SOFTWARE: ACCEPTABLE
Reviews.Author: GORTIZR
Reviews.Content: After reading the comments of other users about this device, I finally decided to buy it. To give you a better idea of the impressions I have had with this after several tests, I will analyze it under some categories, where top rate (excellent) is 5.1. THE DEVICE AS ITSELFIt is small, easy to carry out. It includes an USB extension not too long, it is not essential but helps. If you have a laptop, you can take this device with you in your backpack in the same way you carry the laptop accesories.My rating: 5.2. THE SOFTWARE AND USER MANUALSA CD is enclosed, as well as some documents about the installation and setup. When checking the CD I realized why this device is cheap: it is a CD-R, not an original CD. The installation guide is just a piece of paper with text but no pictures describing setup process. The second document is slightly better than previous one, but it is not anything out of this world; it's a kind of quick but not too deep guide about the device, the software, and some troubleshooting guide.My rating: 2.3. SETUP PROCESSI have a laptop with Microsoft Windows Vista, 3 GB in RAM memory and a 500 GB hard disk. According to the piece of paper, I placed the CD in my computer and began the setup as appeared in the 'manual'. I followed all the steps but my setup process was not the same as explained in the paper. When my DVD drive launched the install window, I began with the driver. After that, Ulead Video Studio 10.0 setup. I don't know what was wrong at first, but when running Ulead Video Studio I got a window showing a problem. I reinstalled the driver and everything was fixed.My rating: 4.4. CAPTURING VIDEOSConnecting the device to the computer is very simple. After that, I opened Ulead Video Studio and selected Capture tab. In few seconds the software recognized the source signal and was ready to begin the capture. That's a very easy thing. There are several video formats to work with, my tests were done with these:* AVI: The one with best results, image resolution is very sharp and clear (of course, it depends on the source media conditions). However, it has a big negative point: ¡¡each minute captured 'eats' 1 GB of disk space!!* WMV: This format makes files with good size. Probably due to its compression nature I found that image resolution tends to have a kind of distortion, it is not as fine as in AVI format. Anyways, I think it is not so serious.* MPG: The software was unable to capture in this format, no idea why.My rating: For general capture process, 5 (for AVI, 5 in quality and 1 in filesize; for WMV, 4 in quality and 5 in filesize).5. EDITING VIDEOSUlead Video Studio has several tools and features to process the captured videos, it seems to be a very powerful software. However, removing unnecessary parts of videos, for example, is not as simple as when using other video applications (like Microsoft Windows Movie Maker). The program interface is not so clear with some buttons and commands.My rating: 2.FINAL CONCLUSIONSIt is cheap and very easy to install and use. I have had previous experiences with video edition, but I consider this device can be easily used by beginners as well as professional users. After completing capture, I suggest making edition with a different program.Overall rating: 3,6.

Reviews.Title: DC60 poor quality
Reviews.Author: Larry Atnip "Larry A."
Reviews.Content: It works, but induces a background noise on any video/audio captured. The sourceof the noise is the device, not the camera, VCR or computer.

Reviews.Title: Will work on mac OS X
Reviews.Author: Noah I. Weston "Noah"
Reviews.Content: I found that "Easycap"  will work, for sure, on my Mac OS 10.5.8 using a downloadable program named "Easycap Viewer". It may work on systems under 10.5.8, but I can't say for sure. You can find it here:[...]I hope this helps people.

Reviews.Title: Works on 64-bit Windows 7, but w/lots of tinkering
Reviews.Author: 802g48240 "802g48240"
Reviews.Content: With quite a bit of digging around, I was finally able to capture old VCR tapes to my PC (and then to DVD). I was able to get both video and audio working, although I did not use S-video, and some of the software I used didn't preview audio (but still recorded it). My PC is a relatively new AMD Phenom II 6-core, 16 GB RAM, w/a high-end NVIDIA graphics card. Because of video quality and limited compression support with the capture driver, I did end up using lots of hard drive space to capture the initial raw video (roughly a GB per minute). I used a 2 TB external drive (eSata, not USB) which had more than enough room (about 28 hours of video) and down-converted the results (my goal was to get it into DVD format).I read the other posts here, so I installed 64-bit drivers. (Google the names if the link does work or is removed):[...]1. STK1160.zip  32bit DRIVER PACKAGE FOR XP, VISTA AND WINDOWS 7  STK1160 for Philips SAA7113 chipset)2. USB-AVCPTSetup_For_Win7.zip  NEW 64bit DRIVER PACKAGE FOR XP, VISTA AND WINDOWS 7  STK1160 ATV BDA for Philips SAA7113 chipset)  - NOTE! This 64bit driver doesn't support s-video3.EasycapDC60_STK1160Grabber_32&64bit.zip  NEW 32 & 64bit DRIVER PACKAGE FOR XP, VISTA AND WIN7 (STK1160 Grabber for Syntek 8113 chipset which is modified from an original Philips SAA7113 chipset by Syntek Semiconductor)Since I had a 64-bit OS, I tested the last two. The last (newer) one was a bit tricker (failed at first), but worked with a reinstall after reboot. I also used the 64-bit version of USBDeview (google: usbdeview-x64 USBDeview.exe) to cleanly remove the driver (Windows sometimes caches old info after a driver uninstall).The bundled ULead VideoStudio will work with some tweaking, but not right out of the box. I tried three other free products and got better results. Here is a quick summary:1. ULead VideoStudio: searched other reviews on this products for some tips. Was able to get video to work, but it didn't produce the best video (Windows Media Format Plug-in, but only up to 320x240) and the audio wasn't clean. The other formats did not work for me. May have been ok for low-res youtube if it wasn't for the audio issues.2. VLC Media Player: worked somewhat better, and was able to compress in-line, but had horizontal (interlacing?) artifacts. Also cumbersome to use. Uninstalled.3. Virtual Dub (64-bit at source forge): this worked fine, but unable to use compression codecs (more of a driver limitation with the STK1160 hardware). Was also able to preview audio.4. Virtual VCR: about the same results as Virtual Dub. Simplest to use, but unable hear audio during preview (but can see audio waveforms). Audio sounded fine in the resulting file.So as far as capturing (open source/free), Virtual Dub and Virtual VCR worked for me. I stuck w/Virtual VCR b/c of simplicity.As far as authoring a DVD, I could try to struggle on with ULead VideoStudio, but I was put off by its clumsiness. Antiquated software bundled w/fire-sale priced device, so it wasn't a surprise. Since I have Windows 7, here is what I'm using (Windows Live products, free from Microsoft):1. Windows Live Movie Maker (for editing, adding titles/effects for videos, conversion). BTW, Movie Maker sees the capture device but crashes, so I still had to use Virtual VCR to capture the original feed.2. Windows DVD Maker (for final conversion to DVD, DVD menus).Anyway, wanted to put this info out there in case some of the other tips don't work for you. Not saying what I'm doing is any better, but it worked for me.If I ever  need to capture anything newer/better than old VCR tapes, I'll certainly look elsewhere. But you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Needs a helping hand:
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: The DC60 hardware seems solid.  The software, however needs some voodoo to get it up and running.  Hears how I did it on my Windows 7 64bit machine:Connect the usb stick.  Let windows bark that it couldn't install. Insert the disc, don't open the autorun, but open the disc folder, if the autorun does lanuch, simply click Browse CD.Go to the "Drivers" folder. Double click setup and install that.  Go back to the root of the disc, and click on that setup.  Let the honestech VHS to DVD 2 SE install.  The serial number for that should be on the disc sleeve.  If you want to install Video Studio SE (I didn't), go to the AP2 folder, and open up Setup.exe.  The serial number is located in the sn.txt file.Open up that honestech program, thats all you should need to use.  Again, the serial number is on the lip of the disc.  For me, the settings were already in NTSC, but if it's not make sure it's not on PAL.  I noticed some extreme audio interference noise.  So I did a google search, in a nutshell heres what to do to fix this problem:Right click on the speaker near the clock, click recording devices.  Make sure USB Audio interface is selected and is the default. Click properties, levels, and change the level all the way to the number 3.  Click ok, ok.I didn't use the included software to burn/author my captures, for that I used a shareware program called ConvertXToDVD.

Reviews.Title: Impossible!
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: This thing literary sucks. I was never able to make it work. The driver software would never install. But one time after working on it for and hour and when I got it to work it made my computer freeze and I got the blue screen of death and it turned off the computer. This thing doesn't even support a 64bit computer, so unless you have a XP I strongly suggest not buying this crap. Not only that but the package it came in looked like something that was thrown together like if you plug this thing into your computer your gonna get a virus. This thing is bad mojo.the paper that held the instructions was cut up and was hard to read. I was so angry at this product I decided to send it back because it was a waste of money. If you are smart you should go buy the Dazzle HD or just the Dazzle DVD Plus. Dazzle comes with freaking Pinnacle 12 studio dude! The Dazzle was easy to work with and did not take very long to make it work. I followed the step by step instructions and boom drivers installed and it worked fine!

Reviews.Title: Please don't buy this
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Despite the numerous negative reviews I was lured in by the price (as I often am). The disc I came with didn't work, I was left with no software. After looking around forever, I managed to get some drivers for it... but most capturing software doesn't work for this. It has no compression settings so I'm left capturing video with no sound at a gig per minute.The main problem is that this product is a clone/ knockoff of some actual brand name capturing device. Amazon gave me a money refund which cooled my frustration - but I can't get back the hours I spent trying to get it to work.Save yourself some headache and buy some other product.Also, there is an website for the 'maker' - their drivers don't work either and they have zero product support so don't even bother trying...

Reviews.Title: Good Product but has Issues Hope This Helps you
Reviews.Author: Jadeeyes240
Reviews.Content: OK I read all the reviews before I bought this and I decided to purchase it and I'm glad I did. First off I'm running on Vista 32 bit home premium and I ran into issues with installing the driver for this here's a trick for all of you running into problems with it.  Put the disk in but install NOTHING! Plug your Easycap in and allow windows to search for the drivers eventually another screen will pop-up asking for you to use the disk that came with the Easycap select the option for the disk you have in your drive and your all set. The name of your Easycap will show up as Syntek STK1150 on your computer so don't uninstall it by mistake this is your Easycap and it'll show up under this name in the video capture software you use also. Problem number 2: the video editing program they give you on the disk to capture and edit your videos is complete crap don't use it unless you really have no other option I would suggest a program like Nero's Nero Vision or Debut Video Capture Software. I also had to use the webcam option on Debut to capture and change the settings to composite on video input also make sure your audio is setup to record. On Nero you have to use the same kind of settings in the options. Well I hope this helps someone out there solve there problems with this device but over all this is a great product for getting you old VHS tapes and Camcorder videos onto your computer for editing and enjoying I would recommend it to anyone just take your time and it will work great. Please ask me questions and I will try to help as best I can.

Reviews.Title: DC60 on Ubuntu Linux
Reviews.Author: mat22
Reviews.Content: I am using this device as a cheap frame grabber for testing vision processing algorithms written in C using the OpenCV library.  Installation was easy, downloaded and installed the driver from [...] and was working with mplayer in less than 10 minutes.  The device construction is poor, while unplugging from the computer the metal casing of the USB connector came off.  I opened up the device and found that the original solder joints were cold joints, so I reassembled the connector and resoldered the joints.  Then shortly after that fix the device stopped working again, after quick troubleshooting, I found a pin on the internal connector that attaches the audio/video pigtail to the PCB was not making connection, which I fixed.  After these two issues the device has worked without issue.Since I'm using this device in Linux, I have not touched any of the included SW and so have no opinion on it's functionality.Overall the device works, but is very fragile due to poor quality control. I would recommend using the supplied USB extension and providing external strain relief for the audio/video cables.

Reviews.Title: EasyCap DC60 on iMac
Reviews.Author: E7YC3
Reviews.Content: I got the EasyCapDC60 in hopes of recording my gameplay from an XBOX 360 on an iMac but there are a few things to know about this product on a Mac computer. First you need to download an application called "EasyCap Viewer" (easily found in google)After that it is very simple. I have recorded some gamplay on my youtube channel at youtube(dot)com/user/E7YC3

Reviews.Title: The best review
Reviews.Author: 808shark1
Reviews.Content: whats up amazon usersi recently bought this ez-cap 2.0 and i am satisfied i am using it for my xbox-360 to post video's on you tube (Qualtiy check on you tube check it out 808shark1 is my profile) i really like this product but i am looking towards buying a dazzle that works for mac's do to the lack of the ez-cap 2.0 compatibility. but i highly recommend this product for any beginner and for the price you cant beat it .For any other question ask me at: [...]

Reviews.Title: Decent product but worth the price
Reviews.Author: I am a Zombie
Reviews.Content: Ok so i was skeptical when i read other reviews but for $14 it was worth a try... when i first got it i tried installing it in my computer but it doesnt seem to work with windows 7 64 bit. fortunately i had a backup computer that runs windows xp 32 bit and it installed fine.  I bought this product to convert some training vhs's to  dvd for my brother.  First try it recorded great, the video quality is what  you expect to see from a vhs but the sound was terrible.  second try i used a 3.5 mm male to RCA female Y connector which i hooked the RCA to the vcr output and then the 3.5 mm to the PC's audio line in and changed some settings in the audio properties and on the ulead program switched the usb audio to pc line in audio and much improvement to the sound quality... now keep in mind the quality of the dvd you make with this product is far from movie studio dvds but it got the job done and recommend it to anybody on a budget trying to  convert vhs to dvd. any questions feel free to IM me at yahoo: skeptikylone or email me  at the same name at yahoo dot com thank you!

Reviews.Title: Works fantastic with Linux!
Reviews.Author: Markus M. Strobl
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this little $9 gadget after reading mixed reviews. I'm running Linux and the Easycap makes no claims to support Linux. That's a shame as it works extremely well!I got a driver from here:[...]I'm now transferring old VHS tapes to the computer with no issues. Picture and sound quality is surprisingly good. Definitely much better than I expected.For reference I found these options to work well for encoding:mencoder [...]This de-interlaces the video and saves it in a raw video format. I tried transcoding to x264 in real time but had some dropped frames. Instead I save in raw format and then transcode over to x264 with:mencoder test.raw -oac mp3lame -lameopts abr:br=128  -ovc x264 -x264encopts bitrate=500 -audio-delay 1.5 -o test.aviI needed the audio delay to make audio sync properly. The resulting file is 2.8 MB/minute.

Reviews.Title: Works just fine
Reviews.Author: B. Hadden "Avid excerciser"
Reviews.Content: Well, I have to say reading the reviews I was very hesitant to try this and was actualy going to get a card to install in my pc thinking that would be better.  Well I bought this and was pleasantly surprised.Their were a lot of good tips from other users as well as from other similar items.  The biggest thing to do with this is once the software is installed you want to ensure to put the video for NTSC which is for American televisions and systems.  The Ulead video software works fine although the audio could be way better and clearer but it works great for my purpose.Another thing was how easy it was to set it up but their is something to note.  You want to ensure that you install this on a pc that has just a little bit of power. For instance I have 2 pc's, one with Vista, 2.2ghz and 1 gig memory and the other pc has Windows XP 3.0 ghz and 2 gig memory.  Of course the picture quality and video smoothness worked better on the 3.0ghz.  I think if you put it on something with lower than 2.8 ghz you will not get as good of video.I am happy I didnt get the card because it would have been that much harder to install and uninstall when I wanted to test it on the different pc's.  Not sure if the card would work better but this item works fine and you dont really need to know much about computers to get it working.  The seller did great getting it to me quickly.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: E. Ruelas
Reviews.Content: For what i payed, i think its just about the quality i expected. I, like others, had trouble getting it to work. the included software sucks, i used Golden Videos by NCH Software [...] and it worked great and is free. You have to toggle some settings for the device to receive the right video input. The easycap is automatically set to receive video input from TV tuner, switch it to composite or S-Video. then it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Very nice, low price.
Reviews.Author: NeoGeo24Bit
Reviews.Content: I bought the EasyCap 2.0 for $12 so I could make copies of my VHS tapes onto DVD.Installing the software was easy, however it does take time to get the settings right. Take your time. However, as some have pointed out, the USB sound is very shallow, scratchy, and muddled. No matter what I did, when I would capture a piece of audio and video, the video would be fine (in DVD or MPG mode at least) but the sound would be low quality and not be something I'd want to put on DVD.Searching around on YouTube, I found an answer. Simply "split" the audio cables (white and red) from the video. Keep the video (yellow) plugged into the EasyCap, but split the audio (red and white) using a Y Adapter, plugging the Y adapter into the "line in" or "microphone" jack of my onboard CPU sound card. After adjusting the recording volumes, now I get crystal clear sound whether I'm copying a VHS tape to my computer for transfer to DVD, or recording my gameplay on the Xbox 360, Playstation 3, and Wii for streaming to Justin.tv, YouTube, etc.You can also use Windows Movie Maker or most any other "software" for recording. You don't have to use the Ulead software if you don't want to. I'm going to order another EasyCap as a backup and one for my friend. It is well worth the $12-$15!

Reviews.Title: Be an expert!
Reviews.Author: E. P. Schlaikjer
Reviews.Content: My father has an old analog video camera and we want to convert the tapes to digital files. So I bought this Easy CAP, figuring it is cheap and there was a chance that it would just work. We used the yellow and white leads, as the videocam does not have S-video. After installing the driver (XP), and rebooting for good measure, I could get audio but not video, using the capture page of Pinnacle Studio. Then I tried the capture facility of Sony Vegas, and it could not use the device at all. I thought about installing Ulead, which comes with the device, to see if it worked. But I did not really feel like installing yet a third video program. So I gave the device to my son, who went to work on Linux. After downloading a device driver, recompiling it, and tweaking it extensively (using mencoder and VLC) he can get mpegs with sound and video. Too bad Pinnacle is bad at using mpegs as input! Anyway, it IS possible to get this thing to work, but you need to be pretty persistent.Update: tried installing on Vista to see if that would be simple. It was not: got a generic "driver failed to install". As for the mpegs produced on Linux, the sound is poor, with a pulse to it, but that could be the old camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Dustin Madden
Reviews.Content: It was just what I was looking for and needed. Product was exactly as described above. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this product and "the Brilliant Store"
Reviews.Author: The Grouch
Reviews.Content: I've had this thing in the package for the better part of a year and went to use it the other day.  Had a heckuva time loading the software. The system did not want to recognize the disc! Once it finally loaded I tried the dongle.  Audio works ..no video.  Worked with the thing for over an hour ...no luck. Upon loading the software I had noticed the driver was from 2006.  So I go to the manufacturers website click on "driver" and it says any updated driver would be available thru the retailer.  So I contact the retailer(The Brilliant Store).  They advise that there is no update available online.  (Gee..No ##!+ Sherlock!..I knew that!) So they ask what operating system I'm using.  I answer XP.  They come back and say "well it may be defective but we aren't gonna replace it because its out of warranty."  Meantime the manufacturer is claiming its a forged product.  Talk about "He done it!"  Over $8?  Gimme a break! STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT and THIS RETAILER

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this junk
Reviews.Author: Linbertg
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this junk both software and hardware are not working. I have tried both Windows XP and Windows 7 both OS are unable to install the device driver, confusingly, the device name will changes by itself either "USB 2.0 grabber" or "SKT-1160" when you try to install the device driver and, either no display or no sound, tried to configure to NTC system but still no luck for it. I return it the next day after I received, I don't recommend to buy this un-QC product.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: This device is absolutely PERFECT. I installed the drivers off of the CD on Windows 7 x64 and it setup without a hitch. It shows up like any other video device for capture enabled software (movie maker, Skype, etc.)  I was looking for something like this to use a normal camera as a web cam and for just a few dollars, this can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: WIndows 7 64bit - Buy the Roxio Easy VHS to DVD instead
Reviews.Author: damtwo
Reviews.Content: I purchased the EasyCAP USB 2.0 thinking that for $7 it was worth the shot.  I spent about 10-12 hours trying to copy VHS tapes and could not get the audio to capture well.  The video quality was okay but the audio I was capturing was very staticy and washed out.  I watched numerous youtube videos that explain how to tweak your computer to get the EasyCAP to work but they didn't really help me.I finally got frustrated and gave up on the EasyCAP.About a week later, I saw the Roxio Easy VHS to DVD package on a lightning deal for 19.99 so I scanned the reviews.  There were both a lot of positive and negative reviews.  The negative reviews, though, were mainly about problems loading the software not the audio/video quality.  I decided for $20 (~66% off) I would give it a shot.I should tell you that I'm running a 3 year old laptop with Windows 7 64-bit.  My computer is adequate but far from cutting edge.  The Roxio software and drivers installed quickly for me (in less than 5 minutes) and I am thrilled with the video capture results.The Roxio software has a feature that lets you save directly from the VHS to a DVD in one step.  This feature stopped working after one or two uses (it just hangs up).  Instead now I have to save the video to my computer and then burn it to a DVD, which is what I would've expected to do anyway.  The Roxio software is very easy to use and the process is simple.After buying the EasyCAP USB 2.0 I was convinced I needed to buy a DVD/BHS Recorder for $100+.  Don't do it.  Buy the Roxio product instead and save yourself a lot of time and money.Good luck with whatever you decide to do but keep in mind that the quality of VHS is poor compared to todays standards and your output is only as good as your input.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on December 5th. It got here on the 8th, and i open the box, to find only the EasyCap, and a usb cord. No CD ROM or Instruction Manual. I emailed them this inconvenience and never got a reply. Buy another capture card.

Reviews.Title: Little tricky to install, but works great now...
Reviews.Author: M. Benhart "Benihana"
Reviews.Content: It took me a couple hours to get installed on my computer. A little google help and others, I realized my major problem was the default setting is PAL...never explained to me in the initial set up.Also installed on a Windows Vista computer with drivers supplied by the net, and works perfect!I have not used the included video software.Also have not used the s-video port.

Reviews.Title: It works fine on XP
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to use with a VideoSecu camera.  Construction is OK.  The driver CD it came with was all I needed to get my camera working on Windows XP with the monitoring software I already had.I am only using the yellow video infeed and the quality is pretty good.  I can't speak for the audio, though.It's worth the price, but I question it's authenticity.  It came in a plastic bag with a driver cd that was not in any type of case or protective sleeve.  It could be a knock-off but it works for me.At under $7 and free shipping with Prime, it was worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: THIS ONE IS JUNK
Reviews.Author: Chill
Reviews.Content: only thing that worked somewhat was the Ulead software that came with it and that locks up from time to time..the drivers never did load properly (windows 7..windows vista pro),and micorsoft has a site that says thie product is not comptible...no other drivers are avaliabe..the unit never worked as it claims..for the price,,I got what I paid for it...nothing..it's junkI went to antother internet site and purchased EZ Grabber for a few bucks moreand the two capture programs (EasyGrabber and Homestech VHS-DVD) worked without a hitch.. live and learn...

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: Jorge Ravelo
Reviews.Content: I used with the original software and with other video capture software; in all the trials the result were the same, bad quality video/audio or error on the capture process, don't waist your time o money on this product.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Gavin
Reviews.Content: The software doesn't even install.  It says data2.cab is corrupted and doesn't even work.  Second, I tried out another program and it lags like crazy.  I press a button on my PS3 and it takes about 3 seconds to render it.  If I were you, don't waste your money buy a reliable HD PVR instead of this junk.

Reviews.Title: A FAIL of an Experince
Reviews.Author: Doctor Rubix
Reviews.Content: This product was, at first, what was expected:  Something that I could plug into my computer by USB that would allow recording of things (VCRs, DVD Players, Security Cameras, Game Consoles, etc) with a composite output.  Construction of the item seemed OK, and the installation process was good; for those reasons, I did not simply give it one star.  What made it bad was that the installation was a little rocky, and once it was installed, there was no sound or video coming through despite my computer recognizing the device being there.  First, I made sure the device I was trying to record from was working, which it was.  Then I went on a search for a solution.  After looking for hours and being unable to find any sort of fix (let alone the website of the manufacturer), I found nothing but complaints from other having similar problems.  There was the occasional person who had success, but that seems to be about 1 in 10 who either had it working or eventually got it to work.  Overall, I would say it is a bad product that should be avoided unless you feel like taking a chance.

Reviews.Title: Surprised
Reviews.Author: Michael Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I was extremely skeptical in buying EasyCap.  However, it did exactly what I wanted it to do.  I have windows 7, and the ULead software it comes with was pretty straight forward to install.  I hooked the EasyCap up to an old vcr, hit play, and started capturing.  I was able to take the AVI file and burn it to a DVD without a problem - using the stock Windows DVD Maker that comes with Windows 7.  For the price, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive solution
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jim
Reviews.Content: I highly (HIGHLY) recommend connecting the audio input directly into your computers Mic or Line In 1/8" input.Doing this made the audio crystal clear as opposed to pretty awful using the EasyCap.If you want/need stereo sound you will need to attain a cheap connector/adapter to allow the Red and White RCA audio outputs to converge to a single 1/8" jack to plug into the Mic/Line In. Otherwise, audio will be one-sided mono.I connected like this:Yellow RCA from VCR output to EasyCap Yellow to USB input.Red/White RCA audio output from VCR to RCA-1/8" stereo adapter to Mic input. (DID NOT USE EASY CAP FOR AUDIO)You will have to choose the audio source properly on your recording software (probably sound card).Choose USB for video source.Overall, a great low $ solution.

Reviews.Title: It's cheap but not easy in the slightest.
Reviews.Author: Tech138
Reviews.Content: Just to let you know.  I'm a WAN Engineer with over 20 years in the computer industry.  I figure I'd let you know that just to give you an idea that there are very few technical issues that can throw me for a loop.  Unfortunatly this one did.  There are a few problems with this version of the device:1] The drivers shipped with the item doesn't work with Windows XP.  Particularly XP Service pack 32] Even when you obtain the drivers you can't follow the typical installation procedure.3] The audio quality of the output is terrible.I have found ways around each issue:I've been able to download the drivers from the web. You should be able to find the drivers if you google the dives drivers.  Just make sure that the copy you use has an inf file.  The other compiled installations do not install properly on XP.  I was able to copy these directions from a blog that worked well for me.  1. Download and extract drivers for Syntek stk1160. Note that it is 1160 we want and NOT 1150. UPDATE (4/17/2009): The original site housing the drivers no longer works so I have uploaded them myself. The driver inside the package says "1150" but it is indeed 1160.2. Followed step 5 (and ONLY step 5) of Ashleigh's instructions for editing the oem17 file.  NOTE: do NOT use the files off the CD and do NOT run the setup EXE file from the CD! I did the first time and had to do a System Restore to undo the damage.3. Connect the EasyCap and wait for the "Install new hardware" dialogue to pop up.4. Select the option to select the drivers from a list.5. Select "Imaging device." Windows might not agree with you... whatever, you're smarter than it.6. When Windows has given up installing drivers, say you have a disc, then select the folder where you've extracted the stk1160 drivers.7. Windows may not like this, stating the hardware won't be compatible blahblahblah... just install it anyway.8. After it's all happily installed, go to the stk1160 driver folder. There will be a program called "StkATVAp" with the icon of a little camcorder. Open it.9. "Syntek STK1160" should show up under "Devices"... make sure it's selected. Under "Options," make sure both "Preview" and "Audio Preview" are checked.10. Hook up the EasyCap to your source and start playing a video off of the source (if you're using a camcorder like I am and have speakers hooked up to your computer, put the camcorder in VCR mode and play off a tape... you'll get some annoying feedback from your PC speakers if you attempt to capture live footage/sound).11. Go to "Video Capture Filter" under "Options." In the first tab, make sure the correct video standard is selected (for me, this was NTSC_M)... you will know it is correct because "Signal Detected" should change from 0 to 1. Then go to the last tab and make sure the left check box is identical to what you've just selected, and select the proper hookup method (for me: Composite video). Click OK.12. I got video/sound at this point. If it's still not working for you, go down to "Video Capture Filter" in "Options" and make sure you've got the right video standard (NTSC_M for me).To get around the poor audio just feed the audio from your device directly to the line in on your computer.  Most software will allow you to switch your audio input.  This will allow you to import crystal clear audio and video.  I hope this helps.  Sorry that this is too wordy but like I said, "It's cheap but not easy in the slightest."

Reviews.Title: Forget Windows 7 64 bit!
Reviews.Author: Mark Vassmer
Reviews.Content: I wanted to start capturing my old family videotapes, simple right?  I got a (different) USB capture dongle and it worked on my wife's Vista laptop, but not my old XP PC.  We had a little "electrical problem" while I was putting in a ceiling fan and I accidently fried my wife's laptop . . and the capture dongle so time to get new computers and a new USB capture device.  I got an I5 Windows 7 64 bit HP dv8t laptop to replace my XP unit.To replace the fried USB Capture dongle, I picked a new EasyCAPture DC60 from Amazon based on the Amazon video review of J. Manarang.  Looked easy and effective . . . and, J. assured me, it works on Window 7 64 bit computers!  The unit I got was not the same.  It looked the same, but the package was different, the software was different  . . .and his worked . . .mine didn't.  Mine came with ULead VideoStudio software.  It recognized that I had installed the device, but when I selected it as the source to capture frmo, it would actually change to another video source.  I tried removing, reloading, new drivers from online, even different capture software.  Same symptoms.It did work on my old XP unit though. The MPG files seemed to overcompress the video making it look bad. The better looking, but much larger AVI files were choppy and the voice tended to get out of sync with the video.  That's why I moved up to an I5 Core for adequate pep.I decided to return the EasyCapture for my money back.

Reviews.Title: easy cap
Reviews.Author: guillaume
Reviews.Content: doenst work with windows 7, get only video and no sound.need driver fix

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: WhiteLightning
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the sole purpose of transfering my old 8mm home movies to dvd. It works flawlessly! My old 8mm camera only had rca plugs out, so this works great!

Reviews.Title: easycap 60, not so easy....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "tweak geek"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because I thought it would help me capture and convert my camcorder videos. Well, I have tried it on windows 7, and also windows xp. Neither one will work. I searched the web & also looked at videos on youtube.com. final analysis? Do NOT waste your money.....

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: jiggler
Reviews.Content: i recently bought this easycap to record for video games, and things like that.first impressions: AWESOME! it works extremely well, and is easy to set up.i dont see why so many hate this thing, its great. i would definetly reccommend this to anyone.notes: quality is good, and it works with vista 32 bit. (not 64 bit tho)great product, great price)

Reviews.Title: Used on 1996 Panasonic IQ Palmcorder RCA Connection
Reviews.Author: Vincent H. Yazzie "monument valley"
Reviews.Content: Used the product on Panasonic Palmcorder IQ with RCA Yellow and white connection.  Ran software according to manufacturers instructions and also Microsoft installation of driver software.  Restarted.  Panasonic Palmcorder IQ is an Analog VHS-C with Camcorder Playback.  Connected the appropriate wiring between USB and camcorder via yellow and white RCA jacks.  Live viewing was possible.  Analog video was transformed to MPEG then after a long conversion time to AVI.  Good product, but need lots of disk drive space.  Excellent product.

Reviews.Title: It's cheap and it works!
Reviews.Author: El Cid
Reviews.Content: I was looking around for a capture device to copy videos from my DVR, butI don't want to spend lots of money for expensive devices, since I'm new to this.When this came, installation was surprisingly easy on my Windows Vista laptop,The software included was not a new version but hey it worked! Used theDVD format for capture, tweaked some setting such as source, color,template, video and audio bit rate and the results came out just fine for me.The video sizes were a bit too large so I used a DivX converter to shrink themto an average of 30% of the original without noticeable loss of quality. I'm notan expert in videos and video format but I'm well satisfied with the result.It's cheap, it works, what more can I say. Oh, one morething it doesn't seem capable of HD quality output even with HD videos.

Reviews.Title: just what I needed
Reviews.Author: S. F. Galeano
Reviews.Content: I really needed something like this, the USB adapter works great even though the software it's outdated, still very good.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: P. Quan
Reviews.Content: i have to say these are one of the best sometimes this beats the dazle 10 times 15 bucks for high quality video game footageyeah ill take

Reviews.Title: Works perfect!
Reviews.Author: AG
Reviews.Content: I have no problems at all with this USB Video Capture device. Installed software, drivers and started using it without any issues.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: C. anderson
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried that this adapter wouldn't work,but because of the low price I tried it anyways.I was very pleased with the outcome.You can't produce profesional quality dvd's but you can preserve your memories on dvd or other formats.The software that comes with it is out dated and you cannot even get the patches to fix it(its a little buggy),however the adapter works great with other production software.Please be aware if you dont already have video capture/editing software you might want to include some in the over all cost to see if this is the right option for you.

Reviews.Title: Wow, really?
Reviews.Author: Steve0Yea
Reviews.Content: So, after hearing so much about an "easycap" and how great they are i look up on amazon to see how much they cost.  Unfortunatly i find one for 8 bucks and decide ok, that should be good.  Buy it get it delivered and the damn things audio/video quality SUCKS!  The audio is so destorted it crackles and buzzes, and no its not the way i installed it i know what im doing.  This is a chinese knock off of the original.  The real company had to change their name because of this stupid chinese peice of crap.  They are now known as EZCAP dont buy this product buy the real one, i wasted my time and money on this hunk of junk.  The only thing its good for is a paperweight.PS: Sorry for bad spelling and punctuation but im a little irritated right now, been trying to fix this thing for hours and just found out i got a knock off.

Reviews.Title: Not suitable for Xbox 360 capture
Reviews.Author: J. Den Hartogh
Reviews.Content: I bought this item to capture Xbox 360 gameplay but there are so many versions of this product. The only one suitable for capturing from gameconsoles is the DC60+. Although I must say that the aftersales service is great. Without any problem I could return the product an get my money back. So 5 star for the service but only 1 star for the product itself.

Reviews.Title: No matter how cheap, you shouldn't have to spend hours trying to find and install the right drivers.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Barber
Reviews.Content: There are bad reviews on this which mention that the drivers which come with the unit won't work on many computers. On three of my computers, it would not work with the drivers that came with it.Others have said that for the price, how can one complain? Well; the purpose of this review process is to help people understand what they are getting. Having to spend hours finding the right drivers - often via trial-and-error - should not be a requirement, precisely for a product this cheap and simple.But ultimately, I would never recommend this because you will end up spending much, much more time getting it to work than you will save by not buying a better product, from a better manufacturer.Also for the record: I ordered mine fulfilled by Amazon, so I was confident I would get the right product, and not a knockoff. I did get a genuine product. That much is good. And it seems like the unit works OK, though the recording software that comes with it is... well; it's free. What do you expect?

Reviews.Title: Poorly packaged, arrived broken
Reviews.Author: Jim Newton
Reviews.Content: It was packaged in a simple plastic envelope (no box), and the CD had several large cracks in it that rendered it useless. Without the software from the CD, I was unable to use the dongle. I will not buy from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Great vendor and product
Reviews.Author: Iñaki Jauregui Goñi "Vaskiñan"
Reviews.Content: Item EasyCAP USB 2.0 Audio/Video Capture/Surveillance Dongle received as described.  I recommend this item. Good PriceThanks for your support

Reviews.Title: Bad mistake
Reviews.Author: Adam Smith
Reviews.Content: Audio does not work on included software. Will not record with included software, and I'm pretty sure that my model is a fake Easycap.

Reviews.Title: Complicated and doesnt seem to work
Reviews.Author: LadyNapier
Reviews.Content: I got it to work once but now its not working. I've followed all the instruction manuals and cant seem to duplicate the success I once had. (I even had it with audio which is a HUGE achievement with these things.) I have tried this on Vista and Win7 and am just annoyed at this point and tired of wasiting my time trying to figuar out the "well maybe this will work, if not try this or that" there are about 4 different "how to" guides for this. If you get one, GOOD LUCK!!

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy
Reviews.Author: Bryce Inoa
Reviews.Content: It is bad... you can't even use it on Windows 8. Just save up for a better capture card. ITS SO BAD!

Reviews.Title: doesnt work at all

Reviews.Content: first of all, the installer disk it came with didn't worksecond, it doesn't show up on my pcthird, it doesn't show up on my mac(even though the light is on)seriously, don't by this crap.

Reviews.Title: EasyCAP USB 2.0 Audio/Video Capture/Surveillance Dongle
Reviews.Author: Teresa Halbert "Terri"
Reviews.Content: This was just the right part that we needed and got it for a great price.  My son was needing it for his system and was very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Xavier Grey
Reviews.Content: This product is cheap but works quite nicely. Even if it isn't the HDMI EZ Cap, it's does a splendid job at RCA to digital conversion. I find that the quality of the sound (despite what others say) only depends on the quality of the connection. Though the video decoding isn't the best, this surpasses all standard expectations. This product is of much use to any person wishing to use their gaming consoles or anything else as a portable device. This is a fine product for a substantially lower price than it is worth. I contribute to the rating of this product... five stars!

Reviews.Title: Suuuuuuuuuuucks
Reviews.Author: Lucas
Reviews.Content: This sucks the program that came with it was a fake if could return this I would it wash horibal pice of crap

Reviews.Title: not so happy
Reviews.Author: Mary Jane Fullerton
Reviews.Content: don't know if it is equipment, computer or us, but no matter what we did, even uninstalling several times, we could not make this program work. not a big waste of money, but a waste none the less

Reviews.Title: EasyCap USB 2.0
Reviews.Author: JADENDARKSKY
Reviews.Content: This deffinatly didn't live up to it's discription. The disc that came with it for instalation wouldn't work on my computer or any other computer I tried it on. So, I couldn't use it at all.

Reviews.Title: No problem at all!
Reviews.Author: James Ottaviano
Reviews.Content: Didn't have to download any new drivers or even use the disc; just plugged it right into the computer and Windows found the driver on it's own! Works great to burn things off of a tape, or record and stream SD footage from consoles. The sounds has a slight hiss; I don't know if that's the EasyCap or my A/V cables, but it's not too noticeable. All in all, a good device for six dollars (no shipping).

Reviews.Title: OK for short recordings. Bad for large / long ones
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: Positives : Cheap, easy to use / installNegative : resource hungry, unstable, always crashes after recording between 1hr to 3hrs of recording.  Black casing is flimzy and fell apart from the join.  No customer support. HonesTech would not support as EasyCap (whoever its mfg is)  got s/w and  is responsible to maintain support..  Error Signature: honestechtv.exe  AppVer: 2.5.0.0  ModName: htmpeg2enc.ax  ModVer: 1.1.4.25  Offset: 000552ef

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and use, but you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Steven Wong
Reviews.Content: A lot of the reviewers complain about how difficult it is to install, but I had no problem using Windows Vista.Step 1: Install CDStep 2: Plug in EasyCAP and allow Vista to install the deviceI used this to record video game gameplay which it does fine. All you need to do is press the record button like using a VCR. Oh, and the quality is like VHS, not at all like DVD as it states, even on the highest setting. I do not recommend recording while you play on a console because there will be lag. But I record replays so there's little to no lag at all.At this price, don't expect anything amazing. But if you need a basic, no frills video capture device with price over quality, then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Does what it claims.
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: It's not really fair to give this low marks for not handling video transfer in a professional manner. It's a low-budget device for digitizing analog content. That's all it claims to do, and it does it. I had a driver installed on windows 8.1 in under a minute and was transferring old home vhs movies within 5 minutes of opening the package. It doesn't claim to be a pro tool. Anyone who thinks 8 bucks will get them something along those lines is wasting their time. If you need something to preserve old home movies, and don't want a lot of fuss or expense, this a great solution.

Reviews.Title: Works great on xbox 360

Reviews.Content: It's amazing works great for its price.It deserves 5 cuz of its quality works great with xbox 360 !

Reviews.Title: Good Price, but meh quality.
Reviews.Author: ScottB82
Reviews.Content: I don't think anyone expects this device to capture very good quality video, but the quality it does capture is a bit worse than you'd expect. The setup is easy, anyone could do it with some simple instructions and a little know-how. The device works fine, although sometimes when disconnecting the device it'll make Windows get a BSOD. I got this to use it for recording some old Video Game system gameplay, such as N64, SNES, etc... it works fine for that but the video quality, again, is a bit below what you'd want. It's about to the point that the device is rendered useless, my son has fun with it, but I don't think I'll end up using it very much.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: YourBoinLoins
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting anything great since this is so cheap. I wasn't even going to buy this but the comments made it seem like this was okay for the price. WRONG. The drivers wouldn't install onto my laptop. It took me forever (thanks to the HORRIBLE customer service) to get the driver. Once I started recording my gameplay I saw how awful the quality was. I could barely tell what I was playing. I even watched a few tutorials on how to set up the recording software to maximize the quality. It did look better w but it was stool awful quality. I highly recommend that you don't buy this!

Reviews.Title: Good for Price
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Works well, requires a bit of an unconventional setup but I was able to strip my videos from a VCR effectively with it.

Reviews.Title: Remember what you're buying...
Reviews.Author: Shiloh Danielle Alundra
Reviews.Content: If you need a quick, simple capture card to work with on an older PC then I'd recommend it. It will not work on things like Vista/7/8 and will also not work on Mac or Linux. This is a standard definition capture card and is good for the price, especially since it has a S-Video plug to record with.There certainly is a lot better cards out there but for the price, this one isn't bad if you use it properly.

Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Author: India
Reviews.Content: I got this off a groupon and had no idea that 1) it won't work with an iMac unless you use another adapator 2) it won't adapt my VCR - videos-- to CD which is what I thought I was purchasing and 3) you have to have a laptop...or something...and then have to buy another set of something that has all those white-red-black-yellow cables to plug into the Easy Cap plugs. Complete waste for me.I will say, the first wait was supposed to be 4 weeks--I didn't get it--I told them, and they sent another out Express w/foreign label..probably cost more for replacement postage than the product cost them to begin with. Further, when I got the 2nd one, and told them I was having trouble and that I had an iMac, they responded promptly and sent me to the customer video, so customer service gets a 5 star, the advertising info gets a 1 star, and I really can't review the product because it will end up in Goodwill.

Reviews.Content: Not worth the cheap price even really.  At the very best, at least buy something like a Dazzle DVC maybe.  The resolution and quality out of this was absolutely terrible, and the device itself didn't work very well.

The factory told me to try another of their products, that one failed to perform also. I bought three of these and all of them set-up almost instantly (windows xp needed drivers supplied) These function perfectly, I highly recommend these!

Reviews.Content: Says it will work with Windows XP/sp3, ya right. It doesn't. The software installs, but it won't find the darn capture unit. Plus it doesn't come with the correct software listed. It claims to be a DC60 but it's not. I've tried all kinds of drivers for a DC60 and nothing works. I have Windows 8 loaded on my Laptop, it claims to "see" the device but, you can't install the software. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: Wrong drivers shipped on the install CD.
Reviews.Author: Yue Fan
Reviews.Content: This particular item is being shipped with the wrong drivers!!!Look in Device Manager and see if it shows up as USBTV007 or something along the lines of that and search for drivers for imitation EasyCAP using that chip.  After the drivers install, it will change its Device Manager name to "OEM Capture".  If the says Device Cannot Start in Device Manager then you still have the wrong driver; keep trying different ones you can find online on various forums.It works well with fairly good picture quality after you get the right driver.  However, I paid for 1-day shipping so that I could have it in time for a presentation... stayed up until 1AM to get it working through trial and error.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Glenn Wyatt
Reviews.Content: This "Capture Card" is not good video quality and theres basically no audio and its distorted beyond belief. But for the price I guess you cant complain. It still records stuff in decent quality.

Reviews.Title: Decent product, good for converting video
Reviews.Author: DT
Reviews.Content: The software that uses this dongle is pretty decent, but they charge way to much for the dongle. i was very glad to find this at a decent price so I can continue converting VHS and Hi-8 tapes to DVD.

Reviews.Title: bad cable
Reviews.Author: E-Qwip
Reviews.Content: the device works ok but the USB extension cable is pretty much worthless. i have bought about 5 and have replaced all the extensions. just buy an extension separately. just plugging the device into the PC isn't good because the weight will cause connection problems.

Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Content: Not the best video capture device, But still has good enough quality for any use. I recording game play on it and it was pretty clear. Thanks!

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for I guess. I got this in hopes of recording video game footage. Needless to say it will not fit my needs nor yours.

Reviews.Title: Easycap should be renamed Easycrap
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: I bought this in good faith and followed the directions implicitly but although the device transferred the video, it refused to transfer the sound. I paid a skilled professional computer engineer to spend one hour trying to get the sound but he had no more success. I went on line and found that this was a common problem amongst those gullible enough to buy this rubbish. I even wired the sound into the computer directly via the microphone plug but still no success. This product should be removed from sale before any more unsuspecting customers are duped. It is an out and out fraud.

Reviews.Title: easy cap  video
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: this easy cap with a loading disk  was very easy to hook up to my old video camera and then place all my videos on my computer to you tube if you wanted also its heavy duty

Reviews.Title: Fake - Uses false Product and Vendor IDs
Reviews.Author: Eli
Reviews.Content: The record feature on the software this comes with does not work. It keeps returning an error message.So, I tried using EasyCapViewer on my Macbook, except that EasyCapViewer didn't recognize the device as an EasyCap and would thus not show the video on my screen. After a little research, I found that the driver is looking for the following Product and Vendor IDs: 0x0408 and 0x05e1 (respectively). The product and vendor IDs of this product are: 0x3002 and 0x1b71 (respectively).The above leads me to conclude that this is a fake.

Reviews.Title: didnt work

Reviews.Title: Pretty good

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Stern
Reviews.Content: For the price, definitely a steal. Has similar quality to most expensive game capture cards. This only supports composite and S-video, nothing more. I had to install some drivers for Windows 7, as this is meant for Windows XP. Connects through USB. Need additional cables and splitter if you want to see on computer and TV at the same time. The program this comes with is decent; the ideal program to work with EasyCAP is Flash Media LIve Encoder (which supports capturing and livestreaming).
