Reviews.Title: Cheap knock off of the real device
Reviews.Author: Donna Steiner
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with it. I tried it on 3 computers and couldn't get it to work. Just spend twice as much for the real device and save yourself the hassle.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Duke
Reviews.Content: It does work, but there is a noise bar at the bottom. I personally was not too concerned as the picture from the camera is ok and used for security. Installed easily and worked immediately.

Reviews.Title: vision blurry/gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Jacob Thomas
Reviews.Content: the easy cap itself gives a blurry display for recording, and expect a lag between the video, and it being transferred onto the program and on the screen of the computer.other than the easy cap, the software was good, self explanatory, and after uninstalling twice, the key worked a 3rd time on my new computer. Yaay

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: James Norris
Reviews.Content: This product works great!  Now I am just typing random words to meet amazons word requirement for online purchase reviews.

Reviews.Title: If you want to convert VHS to DVD, this is worth the money
Reviews.Author: Old Man River
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Honestech 5.0 about a year ago and it worked o.k., it cost around $70.  I had trouble with it doing clean audio from cd to mp3 and wrote them about that problem, to which I did not receive a esponse.The vidbox stopped working.  I called Honestech and was told that the vidbox may have a problem, there was no way to diagnose the problem and that I could either buy a new vidbox for around $55 or buy an entire setup on which they thought the best price may be around $70.  I started looking at alternatives and came across the EasyCAP.  For the money, I thought i would give it a try.  The only problem was the USB cable which was supplied was garbage and that caused problems for about a day until I decided to try a different cable.  After the cable was replaced, I downloaded the software (which was Honestech's software version 2.0) and the setup turned out ot be a very basic, easy to use interface.  I converted about10  ours of video, ran it through Windows MovieMaker and burned it to DVD.  This way I had editing capability.  VHS is not as good as digital so don't expect it to be and that is not because of the EasyCap, that's just the way it is.  I have perfectily usable DVD video and it didn't require a lot of effort beyond plugging things together and doing the editing in Moviemaker.  This is a very inexpensive video converter that works.  I am using Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Works Fine
Reviews.Author: Doc Kazoo "The Old Kazoo Maker"
Reviews.Content: I use this with my old vcr video camera and works fine for a cheap alternative.  I have only been able to get to work with the software package that came with the EasyCap but that works just fine for my purposes.  Also works just fine capturing playback from a vcr.  Took me a wee bit of trial and error to learn the software as the documentation was kind of lacking imo.  Nothing that most people can't figure out.

Reviews.Title: Consider the price...
Reviews.Author: S L-J
Reviews.Content: ...and you'll be glad you bought one or more of these devices. I use them to connect two Canon XH-A1's to my laptop, at the same time! Using software switching/ mixing and then stream live. No glitches just good quality (sd) video.

Reviews.Title: does the job as expected. works well. i like it. came on time. good price. i was happy with my purchase.
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: does the job as expected. works well. i like it. came on time. good price. i was happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: This device is great. I bought this 2 weeks ago and its still working strong. I don't understand why so Many people are having trouble with it. I have windows 7 64 bit and it works great. The directions said to install the software from the disk first. After that I plugged in the dongle and the drivers loaded fine. I am now able to record YouTube videos with my xboxI was cleaning up my computer by uninstalling things recently. I uninstalled the VHS to DVD software that came with the disk. This made the device drivers fail to load. I had no clue that this would affected it. All I did was reinstall the software and its fine.Hope my review is helpful for you to get a cheap capture card device.Pros:Easy to install.Compatible with my professional capture software.Easy to use.The quality is 480p but I convert it to 1080pCan change the contrast, hue, brightness and sharpness.Cheap.Cons:None so far

Reviews.Title: Works but fake
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: well this is a fake made by some chinese company that sells this as an easycap but dont worry it still records video and well the audio doesnt record at all if you want a real easy cap they should be about 15 bucks not this cheap if you would like to check the video quality check out my video [...]i also use a different capture program than the one it came with called intervideo windvr3 but if you just want to capture video and dont really care about the quality this will do the job

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: J. A. Froomkin "Jordan"
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this product. The only situation I can see this product being useful is if someone wants to learn the basics of uploading video game footage. Even still, it is not worth the trouble to get such bad quality videos. Even the software is very simplistic and not at all helpful. I would recommend saving up for a medium end capture card if you are just a beginner, which you would need a computer to meet the system requirements for as well. The EasyCap is not worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: EasyCAP
Reviews.Author: Joey Justus
Reviews.Content: this is one of the worst video capture devices i have ever bought it does not record video like it should and the audio is so bad all you hear is a high pitch whine when you listen to a recording or when you play anything on it.

Reviews.Title: A cheap clone of the real EasyCap
Reviews.Author: Joseph Bowen
Reviews.Content: This was a cheap clone of the real easycap and must use the computer's sound card for audio, unlike the real deal.  It was cheap and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: Michael Becnel
Reviews.Content: If you are starting out commentating this is for you if you are on a budget. Would buy another one but I already have Roxio Game Capture HD Pro!

Reviews.Title: dosent work with windows 7
Reviews.Author: william eckert
Reviews.Content: this dosent work with windows 7.. when I order it.. I read the ad.. it said that it did work with windows 7.. didnt see the other reviews until I had it home..

Reviews.Title: White Noise
Reviews.Author: Jacob Nelson
Reviews.Content: This product is half and half.I did (eventually) get it to start capturing,but the audio that is captured produces loud,high pitched white noise, not only while recording,but constantly while playing.This is unavoidable, and I think may be due to the cords.At lower volumes (an almost necessary sacrifice),the noise dies down, and is mostly silent.Capturing video is clear and crisp, not much else I can say there.However, you may need Windows XP to be able to record.

Reviews.Title: Incompatible
Reviews.Author: E. Spalter "Splattman"
Reviews.Content: I guess this product is a good one, but I can't vouch for that definitely, as it is incompatible with my Windows Vista 64 bit - A fact that IS NOT MENTIONED in this description.

Reviews.Title: Great for playing old video game consols on your laptop
Reviews.Author: Dale wood
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this product because I was searching for a way to use my Macbook Pro's screen as a TV for playing my PS2, Xbox, Dreamcast and SNES on.  Being a college student and not having much room for a TV or the budget for some high end TV tuner card or TV (I wont pay 140$ for an adapter) , I stumbled on this thing. It works great,  although you have to use some software you can find by searching "EasyCapViewer by Bentrask" to get the software and you have to use a 3.5mm audio to stereo audio cable while using the "lineIn.app"  for audio.The end result is you get to play (AND RECORD) from old consol games without using an emulator so you can get the real feel for using your old stuff.  Its also cheaper than a TV, I guess you could also record stuff from a VCR or DVD player and some camcorders with it too.There is hardly any latency and it only wigs out when it goes to a completely white screen on the consol side.

Reviews.Title: Cool product
Reviews.Author: Chubby
Reviews.Content: This product is awesome on any system but the PS3. For as cheap as it is I recommend the easycap

Reviews.Title: An Adequite Buy
Reviews.Author: Taz
Reviews.Content: I bought the EasyCAP video recorder to record the images from my television. My T.V. is old, but this worked out at least alright for me. The EasyCAP has 4 cables, 1 yellow video cable, 1 red audio cable, 1 white audio cable, and 1 S-Video cable. This means that you cannot record from an HD T.V. without extra cables. However, my set up is for recording videogame footage, which goes from my console, to a DVD player, then to my T.V.. To use this item, all you do is follow the instructions on the SINGLE SHEET OF PAPER. The device also comes with a fold out paper, but that is uneccicary. So follow what the one paper says, and you should be fine. The EasyCAP actually did quite well for me. The video captured on Silent Hill 2 (PS2) looked excellent, however, the audio seems a bit distorted.Long story short, the device (If used properly) can record fairly good video, and is a cheap solution for people on a budget. The audio is a bit distorted, and I'll update this if I find a solution. So, If your looking for a cheap way to record good quality off your T.V., go ahead and try this $8.00 buy.

Reviews.Title: This thing sucks
Reviews.Author: Nicky S
Reviews.Content: I couldn't figure out how to get a movie off of my camcorder on to the computer. All the settings were all jacked up. Nothing worked. Thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: Video works well (esp. with other software), audio is poor
Reviews.Author: JayHar
Reviews.Content: Captured video at 720x480 well enough on my Windows 7 64-bit system that I don't miss my old Adaptec PCI capture card from XP/32-bit days.  Not high def, but OK for basic use.  Audio came across as 8kbps, very poor/noisy, BUT if you have separate hifi audio line in, then no big problem...and the video synced fine that way.  After struggling a little with the included Ulead VideoStudio software, I got much better and consistent results with the Cyberlink PowerDirector software that came with my Blu-ray burner, using a tweaked profile for MPEG-2 720x480.  Some review(s) here indicated it only works with the included software, but that's not the case.  Notes: For Win64, I followed included directions to download special driver software, first, instead of drivers on CD.  I have left the device connected to source video cable, and no overheating problems.  The included USB extender cable couldn't be any cheaper quality (tiny wire gauge), and that caused some problems...so recommend testing EasyCap without that cable, to avoid headaches...a few bucks on amazon gets you a better extender cable.  So, in summary, if you know what you are doing, and have some better capture software, then EasyCap is a good deal for little dough.

Reviews.Title: Sound is terrible when you do get it working.
Reviews.Author: John Hatcher
Reviews.Content: Here is yet another one star. Who are the people that think this thing is worth buying. The sound is unacceptable and I don't think it is just the one I got. I use Win 7 64 bit. The page that came with it tells you to get the drivers off the internet. When you do as it says and all the drivers are correct you still get no sound. There help is to send you to some lame youtube videos. After much digging I figured out that you have to go to the speaker icon and pick recording devices. Select the USB recorder, pick properties, pick the Listen tab, and then check the "listen to this device" check box. Then when you can finally hear the thing you get some buzz, cracks, and noise. Even disconnecting the video and one of the sound leads didn't help.If all you want is video it is fine. I sent it back. I cost me nothing but time thanks to it being an Amazon product, fulfilled by Amazon and shipped by HDE.

Reviews.Title: Did not work with Macbook Pro 2009 and Mountain Lion
Reviews.Author: Ariel Balaguer
Reviews.Content: I could not get this to work with my macbook pro 2009 and mountain lion.  I might have purchased the wrong item.  I know there are some other devices similar to this so if you're using Mountain Lion this may not be the correct choice for you.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Shirley Hobbs
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed in the product.  I have not been able to get it to work properly, even following the suggestions put forth by other viewers.  Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: A must need for Mini Wireless Color Camera with Microphone to PC
Reviews.Author: charles martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to go along with my Mini Wireless Color Camera with Microphone that I purchased. If you want an easy way to hook up to your PC this is a necessary item, simply attach it to the cables from the AV Reciever and plug it into a USB port and you're on your way.(of course after loading the program)

Reviews.Title: As someone stated earlier, it's most likely fake.
Reviews.Author: ReneReaper
Reviews.Content: After trying to get this thing to work for Windows 7 64-Bit with my PS3 for about eight hours I finally gave up and decided to try something else.Looking through the packaging, the manual, and the disc I realized this product is almost without a doubt a fake. There are typos on not only the disc itself, but also the instruction manual as well.Not only that, but it seemed that this product simply wasn't going to work after also trying it with Windows XP.Overall the product doesn't work at all, and like I said is most likely fake.

Reviews.Title: Unit died after two weeks of use
Reviews.Author: Titus from Texas
Reviews.Content: I bought this for converting my VHS 8hr EP recorded tapes over to my HDD. I tried to use this device with Ubuntu/Mint linux distros and converting the video with VLC. It recorded the video from VHS to h.264 encode fairly well, there were audio synch problems, but that has more to do with compressing video in h.264 while compressing audio with mp3, an issue that can only be corrected with far more expensive and superior video equipment. Finishing up my tale, the dongle started capturing video garbled and distorted, I checked my two VCRs to see if the heads were dirty or worn, but the VCRs had no problem displaying on two separate TVs(HDTV and SDTV). I've dealt with these dongles before, I had a Diamond HDTV110 that lasted for about a year. Once the video is distorted it's a sign the chip is going out.In summary, you get a mixed bag with these USB sticks, some will work for about a year and others die on the spot. For $7 I wasn't expecting the world of this device, but I would have at least have liked to finish converting more than just two tapes with it. I may have to bite the bullet and simply get me one of the Hauppage capture cards I've been reading about on various AV forums.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: PLL455
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this device because it was so inexpensive, but it wasn't worth it. It seemed to test out OK, but I had better results using it for video only & running the audio through my normal sound card. One glaring fault is that the CD that was shipped, which was supposed to contain video editing software, was BLANK. It was labelled, but there were NO files on the CD. It's impossible to find a replacement, so if I were you I'd hold out a little longer, spend a little more money & buy a better product.Item was shipped promptly, no problems with service from the seller - I never returned it because I didn't even open it for weeks, not until I actually started converting video. Besides, it was so cheap it wasn't worth spending the money on return shipping.

Reviews.Title: does not work on dell windows 7 64 bit
Reviews.Author: captian caveman
Reviews.Content: Tried to hook up PS3 to laptop for gaming.  Installed lots of drivers watched lots of videos but it simply does not work on my dell inspiron windows 7 64 bit.  It puts the driver in the wrong place and will not pick up any video at all. DO NOT BUY! Worthless.

Reviews.Title: EasyCap USB 2.0
Reviews.Author: zorak999
Reviews.Content: This product is easy to use comres with software included. The price is more than reasonable and delivers the same same results as it's more expensive competitor...Those with a little "savvy" will learn it's capabilities right away.

Reviews.Title: Works, more or less, but wrong chipset
Reviews.Author: 0xac
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not an EasyCap. It's a USBTV007, whatever that is.So yeah, the software works (well, kinda) in Windows (though laptop fans come on quickly), but there is almost no hope of this working under Mac OS or Linux. I was considering writing an OS X driver for it, so please understand that I am not the radio shack guy telling you that a USB mouse won't work with your Mac; this thing really actually won't.Decent/cheapish build quality, would have been 3-4 stars had they not lied about it being an EasyCap.

Reviews.Title: The best value for money buy i have ever made
Reviews.Author: mistiriO/S
Reviews.Content: I just couldn't believe how cheap it was. I thought if it didn't work i wouldn't mind the money. It was delivered very fast and it works flawlessly on an old pc with windows xp that i use for security cam watching and recording. There is an old version of Ulead Video Studio included but i use iSpy (free software) which sees the usb grabber just fine.

Reviews.Title: For Rookies
Reviews.Author: D. Chaney "T.Johnson"
Reviews.Content: This device is great for recording low resolution gameplays at a low price. It installs very easily and is easily setup hence the name "EasyCap". If you are looking for the best quality you are in the wrong area, for the device is merely for rookies. People that all in the learning stage. Shipping does not take very long, less than 2 days depending on where you live.

Reviews.Title: Does the job for a low price
Reviews.Author: Naveen Jayakumar "Naveen"
Reviews.Content: Product eval:- Product usage: I bought it to play n64 on my laptop- Shipping: Decent speed, got the product within the estimated delivery.- Performance: Works perfectly, no significant delay, audio quality is acceptable- Cons: the plastic casing was poorly snapped into place.  I fixed this with wrapping clear tape over the chassis a couple of times, and poked holes in the tape so the unit has air flow.  This might have just been my unit, not sure if all of them will have this defect.  However, this had NO effect on performance.Bottom line, this is an amazing product that does what it says (for me it was to use my laptop as a tv screen) for such a low price.  Do not expect a HDMI-tier product for 11$.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: this was a nice item to buy
Reviews.Author: overlord509
Reviews.Content: it was my first capture card i got and it works smooth. i made a hole bunch of videos with it and my friends were in shock on how good the quality was

Reviews.Author: Creative Nerf "Creative Nerf"
Reviews.Content: Product snapped at usb extender and then at usb entrance. Now I have a piece stuck in my laptop and the rest in the trash. *is currently looking for pliers*

Reviews.Title: Caveat emptor
Reviews.Author: R. Sills
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this product (and others) and decided to try this one based on the cheap price. If it didn't work - I'm not out a huge amount of money. If it did work - I could talk about what a great deal I got. Well, I did get it to work and it did do what the seller claims so I guess all is good. Before you buy this device yourself, I would caution you to be prepared for some serious seat-time before you can achieve (partial or self-negotiated) satisfaction. The driver that was sent on the included CD probably works fine for something but not for this device. It took scouring the internet and reading many forums, following dead links, phony files, trying several drivers and PC settings before I finally found one that allowed my device to capture video. I actually captured the audio at the same time but the external speaker was dead while capturing video. It was something that I had to come to terms with in order to complete this ordeal. I finally pulled the video I needed off the VHS tape and stored it on my hard drive for editing. That was all I bought this for. Whew! I guess you could say it was worth it. Right? Of course, (disclaimer)actual results may vary on your device.

Reviews.Title: Many problems, but works... barely
Reviews.Author: Camoceltic
Reviews.Content: I bought this product, expecting it to work relatively well for playing my PS1 on my laptop, but there are a lot of problems.PROS:Captures video at decent qualityPretty small (Can fit in my hand)Comes with basic video recording and editing softwareDespite common complaints that the video doesn't work at all without the drivers on 64 Bit systems, it works relatively well for me, but 64 Bit drivers increased quality.CONS:Doesn't work with any programs for recording, other than those that come with itThe supplied CD with the software and drivers did not supply 64 Bit driversThe website I was told to go to in the letter that came with the product was flagged by my Anti-virus software as suspicious (the site was hottestdealsever.com)Audio quality is completely unacceptable.  There is white noise in the background and clicking most of the time.The video editing software forces my laptop to not be able to use Aero, and it can't be resized from full-screen.  It blocks my taskbar, making it impossible to switch to other programs without ALT+TABing.Honestly, I'd say pass on this product, or get an RCA to 3.5mm adapter to record the audio.  I bought this from HDE nearly a month ago, and I'm still working on getting it to work with acceptable quality.

Reviews.Title: save your money
Reviews.Author: Nicholas
Reviews.Content: i bought this along time ago and just now reviewing it. I bought this for the same reason i wanted to record my gameplay it works ok the only problem is it would sometimes come loos and i needed to buy split cables and other things just to get the in game voice i would say save your money get something better

Reviews.Title: Fake
Reviews.Author: BriBri
Reviews.Content: The CD has the wrong program!! Do not buy!! Thats all i have to say about the product... GARBAGE!! To much trouble dealing with all this...

Reviews.Title: "Fast - Cheap - Good" Pick any two.......
Reviews.Author: Delos D. Harriman
Reviews.Content: This device is a real adventure.  I say that because you'll never really understand what your experience will be until you roll the dice and plunk down the seemingly small sum of ten greenbacks.  The adventure starts after it arrives.  Will the drivers work?  Will both the video AND the audio device install?  Will you have to wire the audio through the line-in jack and guess at setting the gain?  Will the Ulead software even display, let alone render a video file that you can play on another device?  Won't it be fun to learn how to sync the audio with the people's lips?  So read everyone else's reviews and you'll finally get the picture...... Yes it is cheap and for some user's configurations it simply works out of the box, but not for mine.

Reviews.Title: cheap
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought it in hopes of convert old VHS tapes through my ibook. Not caring too much about quality. But the conversion is just off kilter. The image flips and fuzzes. And I know it's not the VCR because it works fine on my TV. Also the audio didn't work through easycaps usb so I had to run a converter cord from the vcr to the audio in jack on the laptop. Total waste of time for me.

Reviews.Title: Good for Starter Kit
Reviews.Author: jesse "Shadows"
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe at first that I paid $6 for a capture kit, but it is a bit noticeable as to why: as a fresh reviewer, I need the right equipment for the job, and this squid does just that. However, I've noticed certain fast games can be fuzzy due to the speed of the characters (for example, Sonic the Hedgehog 4 Episode 2). Other games like Halo or Minecraft do just fine to my knowledge, and make this purchase worth it for the cheap price.

Reviews.Title: Working on Ubuntu 11.04
Reviews.Author: jmjaureguig
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a composite video capture board to CCTV, this work right out of the box with Ubuntu 11.04, no need to change anything, just run indicating the number of device and that's all.

Reviews.Title: Worked good, but a little cheap feeling
Reviews.Author: designateddoug
Reviews.Content: Easy Cap worked good and I got what I needed out of it, but it feels really cheap and the usb cap was lost after one use. Not that you need it but I wish there was a way to keep it attached while using the dongle.

Reviews.Title: Adaquate, but nothing special
Reviews.Author: Doctor Welch
Reviews.Content: This device is extremely cheap and works if you are satisfied with low quality video. I got this device because it was extremely cheap and I was hoping to record footage from old consoles as well as recent ones like the Xbox 360/PS3 without spending too much money, but as it turns out the quality and hassle is too much to make it worth purchasing. The audio bug requires you to feed the audio through your line-in instead of using the device, but that's not too big of a deal. The real problem is the video quality and the reliability of the device is poor. Capture footage of newer consoles is a waste of time, and although older games look fine, the device occasionally drops frames and desyncs audio which becomes a hassle to deal with.Basically, if you don't mind mediocre recordings or aren't using this for any kind of serious/important capture than its a perfectly fine device. But if you actually care about the quality, I would save up some money and buy a higher end product.

Reviews.Title: not a good item to buy
Reviews.Author: MobaliAwa
Reviews.Content: No good at all I would not suggest it to any one else, it never workedi'd like to have a replacement send to me but...don't go with this item

Reviews.Title: Product is good but foudn a work around with the problem.
Reviews.Author: Isaac
Reviews.Content: At first when i had bought the easycap everything about it was a problem, the drivers disk, the drivers it self, but I did not give up on this product and i have found a work around with the defects of this product, as mentioned in alot of easycap videos, this product has good image quality, but horrible sound, I have found a work around with these defects, after i have applied them the easycap became a cheap and easy way in order to capture my gaming videos. an example of my HD quality with out s - video is here --->[...] If you need help with the easycap please like and rate the video and I will gladly help.

Reviews.Title: EasyCap USB 2.0
Reviews.Author: mr scott
Reviews.Content: I am pretty computer savvy to say the least.All three O/S I used included software + also tried Virtualdub, VLC, and a couple other recommended capture programs.With similar results as below.Ubuntu Linux displayed video from VHS, for a short while - sound was terrible. But video would freeze after a couple seconds.XP pro, VHS video was jittery and scrolling, sound was distorted.Win7 64bit Video was ok - if you where going to master it in a video editing program, no sound from USB card - used soundcard from pc. Included software would not recognize pc sound card for capture.Tried another VHS and scrolling video only.I am thinking EasyCap USB doesn't by pass the Macrovision protection for VHS.I would stick with the Hauppauge PVR - PCI cards.  IMHO cheapest alternative to buying a video stabilizer or TBC to get around the Macrovision.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it. Simple as that.
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: It only works after awhile and it just stops working. I tried using for gaming but it wasn't that great, then again it is only 4 dollars. But not worth the try, I wish I never spent those 4 dollars. Also, when it does work, the audio is very buzzy and it is very annoying and you're better off not recording audio. Those are my two cents.

Reviews.Title: it's already broken
Reviews.Author: evanintyroberts
Reviews.Content: I bought this about a month ago.  I didn't treat it poorly, and I took good care of it.  It recently stopped doing what I wanted it to do, and my USB drive doesn't even recognize it being in my computer anymore.  I know it's cheap, and it did it's job very well for a while.  I'm just sad that it's broken, and I didn't expect it to break so easily.

Reviews.Title: Does not work well
Reviews.Author: nestor
Reviews.Content: This crap does not work properly after several attempts I could run the program. connect my video camera and video hi8 ran fine but without sound. sometimes I have to close the program and back on so you can recognize the device. I'm biendo how to connect the sound of the computer otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Johna
Reviews.Content: I bought the easy cap to record Xbox 360 game-play, and it did it pretty well. I was getting smooth video and audio, not HD of course, but pretty nice for an $8 capture card. I went away to work for a weekend and came back to a black and white output and the card would give out for a moment every couple of minutes. I don't know exactly what happened to say whether or not the product was at fault but with 2 weeks of use, the product proved its worth. I'd like to say I would buy it again, but, I believe that an HD PVR would suit my needs better. So if you have a decent computer with plenty of hard drive space, you will be able to record 480p video with  an $8 card. Though, I would suggest to buy the S-Video Xbox 360 cord (Xbox 360 S Video AV Cable) to improve the quality 10x.

Reviews.Title: Works well if you follow Internet Advise avoid disk
Reviews.Author: digitalwebnet
Reviews.Content: Works well with my Cyberlink Power Director and Total Media Capture software purchased products - I already own from Kworld PC TV Tuner (you'll need to adjust the video controls for the speed of your computer -- needs some fiddling).  Use a Video-Audio Converter to reduce the size of the video and audio once completed. Also works with Debut and BB Flashback free products but needs a lot more fiddling. Did not use the disk use forum advice -- sabrent.com/product-manuals/USB-AVCPT_Manual.pdf and altoedge.com/video/video-to-usb-ae-easycap.html sites work best to help with installing hardware. Use Audio Line in from Microphone jack for audio with small splitter to 3.5 mm stereo to the computer microphone jack directly from VCR player (this gives you the best audio) the video composite cable stays hooked up to Easycap.  This should help you if you feel you have the technical know-how and patient to try to get the device to work -- it does if you follow the Internet Advice and not the accompanying CD disk.  EasyCap is most affordable but a pain to get it to work but does if you have patient and technical know-how.Recently install Windows 7 and now the EasyCap device is not working -- so I purchased Kworld Video Capture Device and they keep their drivers on their website.  The Kworld Video Capture USB 2.0 device works with Windows 7 and contains very good instructions to get the device to work!!!

Reviews.Title: works with another capture software
Reviews.Author: shady
Reviews.Content: the software doesn't work with windows 7 , too much errors had to download another capture software to get to work and without audio... yet

Reviews.Title: Customer Service/Accessibility/Software
Reviews.Author: wheeladrew
Reviews.Content: The product works. There is no debating that, but the customer service and actually getting the program to work is so difficult that I ended up having to write custom script in linux, having given up in windows, when you buy this you should know about the hours of work you are getting yourself into.

Reviews.Title: At least it made a nice spark in the microwave.
Reviews.Author: TerraLord
Reviews.Content: If all I wanted to do was change VHS to digital, then this would work ok. It would, if it didn't beak when I took it out of the usb slot. The thing fell apart in my hands.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Andrew on the go
Reviews.Content: This was shipped with unexpected speed and was easy to hook up and install.  Everything works and am able to copy video to computer

Reviews.Title: don't work with windows 7
Reviews.Author: photo king 2012
Reviews.Content: the product might have worked if i was using vista or older windows.  But window 7 did find the capture devise drivers even after i installed the

Reviews.Title: Installation CD already broken
Reviews.Author: Samuel Anuoluwapo Aina "SammyDplus"
Reviews.Content: I was really skeptical about buying this product, so, i figured buying from amazon direct would be safer or better. No, i was wrong!The Installation CD was already broken almost in two by the time it was delivered.. and it was a pain in the neck trying to find the right installation software, dodging all kinds of trojans and viruses from various sites claiming to have EasyCap driver.. What a mess!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy!
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: I bought this easycap thinking i would get decent quality. Turns out this is a knock off of the real product! the quality of the video is trash and the sound(if it even works) is horrible. Do not buy this buy the real Ezcap from the actually company. I am extremely upset about this.

Reviews.Title: Great tool to backup VHS to DVD
Reviews.Author: Blue Bamboo
Reviews.Content: Cheap, simple toy to copy VHS tapes (copy protected or not) to a computer then use a DVD creator software to burn to a DVD.

Reviews.Title: Easycap is AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: Viperpuppy
Reviews.Content: Easycap worked great for what I needed to put all my old videos of my family on dvd's. I finally get to see my kids when they were younger.. So pleased and overwhelmed. Great price and awesome software.

DO NOT install the drivers on the disc as they are completely outdated, instead look up the drivers online, there are many videos online to walk you through this. Second off don't use the included software for recording, I have found that Windows Movie Maker though the webcam option is your best choice.Third DO NOT use the audio connectors on the easycap as they are complete pucky, instead invest in a RCA to 3.5 jack adapter and plug it into your mic port for crystal clear audio. If you have Video Editing software like Sony Vegas, this is a plus because it will allow you fix any motion blur caused by the cheap hardware.Included is a Video with recordings of the easycap after applying optimal settings. (bear with me on the quality because of amazons 100mb limit, It gets better trust me)

Reviews.Title: Too much work...
Reviews.Author: cfcdog13
Reviews.Content: If you wondering if you should get this to record your PS3/Xbox 360 gameplay, don't bother getting this.  First of all you need to buy spliters and a double headed cord. Second of all it is not compatible with windows 7 so you have to search around for drivers.  Even with the right drivers my sound was terrible.  It seems to work for some people but not for others.  I guess if you want to take the chance go ahead.  I did and it does not work.

Reviews.Title: not as bad as you think
Reviews.Author: Ben "ben"
Reviews.Content: its a great device for the money i had to look for drivers but no problem with that. audio does not work:( still have to find driver so its was good for the money. video quality is mediocre.

Reviews.Title: might be good if it worked
Reviews.Author: Famous Ed
Reviews.Content: I consider myself above average on computers and software.  I bought this item and paid extra for a rush delivery because I had a project deadline.  Nothing critical but I really wanted to get it finished.  Well, it arrived on time and I followed the broken English directions step by step.  It installs as the wrong type of device automatically but shows it is installed correctly. Using Ulead (that comes with cables) the device never shows anything.  All I get is a black screen.  no sound, no video to record.  Once I got what appeared to be a slight flicker in the color but I haven't even seen that since!I have uninstalled and reinstalled the hardware, software and drivers MULTIPLE times and even tried different options.  I have searched on line for suggestions and found nothing that enables it to work.  6 hours total of trying to make it work and I am still pulling out my hair.

Reviews.Title: Questionable
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get this to work with either Mac OSX 10.7 or Windows 7.  Maybe it works with older OSes, but not those two.

Reviews.Title: This is a counterfeit knockoff forgery.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Chicken Lady"
Reviews.Content: This item, and probably all the other ones selling for $7 are cheap knock-offs. They are EasyCAP DC60++, which is one too many plus signs. When you plug them in, they identify themselves as USB007, and the drivers do not work under Windows 7.If you're very lucky and patient, you might get them to work with the software on the CD, which is NOT Ulead, but some no-name crap. The capture dongle won't work with other software though.I learned my lesson, the price was too good to be true. Glad Amazon is great with returns.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed at all
Reviews.Author: RayU
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed with the EasyCAP.  There's a reason why it's so cheap - you get what you pay for.  I've owned/used several other brands of video capture USB sticks to use for video conferencing, and this one is the worst.  I wanted to see if I could get similar quality for much less cost.  Not this time.  The driver installation was horrible, and the video quality of the EasyCAP is noticeably inferior to the other brands I've used.  The EasyCAP now goes into the desk drawer as a 'test unit of last resort'.  (My current favorite for the price: Mygica Capit.)

Reviews.Title: Great customer service, and good product. Good for starter video capturing.
Reviews.Author: Gato
Reviews.Content: -Update-I have have confirmed that this product will work on vista 64bit, and windows 64bit. In order to do this DO NOT USE the driver on the disc. Plug in the easycap, let windows scan(this will not find the driver). Go to [...] and Download DriverMax. Allow Drivermax to scan your computer, once the scan is done go to Menu and click identify unknown hardware, this will find the stk 1160 driver and allow you to download and install the lastest driver. I found this works well with virtualdub video editing software. I have also noted, that if your are running virtualization software such as vmware, and virtualbox, the easycap will have issues with driver detecting. I hope this information will take away a great deal of stress with the setup issue.I worked retail for a while, and every once in a while you get a dud unit. This was the case with the first adapter I got, unfortunately it would not recognize on any of my machines. After finding my invoice, i contacted HDESHOP. Great customer service, they was very helpful, responded to me in a timely matter, and sent my replacement right away. This product works well on my vista and windows 7 32bit, my linux 32bit and 64bit machine. I hear it will work on 64bit windows and MacOS 10.5-10.7, youtube is a great resource for tips and tricks on this video capture device. It is extremely function device for the price, great for anyone whom wants something at a reasonable price, to get into video editing. In my opinion, this has better quality of capture then that of the Dazzle products I had in the past.Thank you very much for the speedy response HDEPSI would recommend the following specs for video capture.Windows 7, Vista, XP (32bit)Intel or Amd Dual processor or higher (have gotten this to capture good quality using am cap on an Intel atom N455)At least 100GB hard free (high quality video files will be large)2GB of RAM or higherUSB 2.0 (required)(I found additional driver help, and product reviews on the following:  [...] )and make sure to read the manual before plugging the device in as well.

Reviews.Title: Not quite what it says
Reviews.Author: U. Perpar
Reviews.Content: I received product promptly.I did not have any problems installing the software and drivers, did not come with ulead software.I was not able to capture sound, video was ok.Attempted to get help from software company....they said contact manufacturer.I wound up getting a refund from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Kevin P. Mai
Reviews.Content: Software is crap, image quality sucks, and it broke within 4 months. Do not buy this, it is not that great and is very frustrating. SOUND QUALITY AS ATROCIOUS.

Reviews.Title: POS
Reviews.Author: ahw
Reviews.Content: This thing is not even worth the 5-6 dollars you see it being sold for, quality is terrible even after you get it working.  The drivers are crap and it takes forever to finally get it working.  Don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: Easy Cap
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: Its an okay product I use it so I can play my Xbox on my laptops screen if your expecting HD video then you will be sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Crappy, waste of money and time
Reviews.Author: WillNic "nick"
Reviews.Content: This product does not work with my laptop. I could not even install the software that came with the CD. It stopped in the middle of installing. I waited for hours but the progress bar still didn't move, I could not even close the window, had to hold the power button so my laptop could be turned off. So I downloaded similar program. Apparently the software that came is version 8, although there are version 11 online. The software could not even detect the device. Crappy and a waste of money and my time trying to find solution online because I thought it's my laptop that has a problem. After hours of trying, I decided that it's the device that is not working properly. Don't buy this thing, buy another version of EasyCAP

Reviews.Title: its ok
Reviews.Author: K. Barnes "joe"
Reviews.Content: you get exactly what you pay for when you record a video the audio is about a 6.5 or 7-10 the audio is really bad 3-10 but all in all OK just replace the audio with music or voiceover like i did for my MW3 gameplay vids on youtube
