I did expect it to function. This is just a side-by-side comparison of the resulting video capture with my old-school USB video capture box and this one, fresh out of the package. Not only is the video suspect, but the audio is out of control. The only way around it seems to be to run audio from your source into your regular line in and control it that way. On the bright side, I only spent five bucks on this mess.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it, trust me.
Reviews.Author: rocketman7k
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am very capable of working around small bugs or glitches on a computer. I tried to get this thing to work for 2 days to no avail.First of all: You get what you pay for. I paid the least, and got something that didn't work.Second: There are no clear instructions, beware.Third: The included software does nothing to help you use the device.Fourth: I find myself back on Amazon to purchase another.

Reviews.Title: Loved it, But some issues..
Reviews.Author: Ramblewolf
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted an EasyCAP before, and Finally I ordered one and got it in the mail Very quickly! I use it for recording my gaming, and It mostly works, but for some reason, I can't record my for any more than 4 minutes because it'll freeze. And not just recording, The EasyCAP's Video Freezes every few minutes, and I have to unplug it, then plug it back in. If it weren't for that, I'd love this EasyCAP! Another problem was that the USB Extension they gave me was broken.. It doesn't work at all, But thankfully I have many USB Extensions that work just fine. If it didn't freeze, I would be happy with it! I'm not saying that It's a bad product, If it didn't freeze, It'd be amazing, But maybe the one I received just had some problem with it. I really wish I could rate it higher :(

Reviews.Title: Easycap Works Great!!!
Reviews.Author: Bigboiiswagg21
Reviews.Content: The easycap works i just plug it in and capture my xbox 360/vhs tapes /ect. people need to take there time to install the driver correctly.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Content: arrived in a much faster time than estimated, and it gets the job done, you MUST tweak the settings in order to get maximum efficiency out of the EasyCAP, don't expect AMAZING quality but with the settings tweaked up properly it can be decent or meet satisfactory expectations

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Disapointed
Reviews.Content: The installation CD was damaged, the audio is noisy and there is no driver support by the manufacturer. I am really dissapointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: used for xbox 360
Reviews.Author: shawnandkamry
Reviews.Content: I used this for an xbox 360 never really got it to work but it was made with great materials and very strong.

Reviews.Title: low price low quality
Reviews.Author: Mohd
Reviews.Content: i was looking for a capturing device to make some DVDs fro VHS and i decided to try this but this device very dissappointed me cuz the video and audio quality of this device is very very poor...i dont like it at all... well its not that expensive i can forget my money...but its not worth $2 dont waste ur money...

Reviews.Title: Very good catches of TV
Reviews.Author: Lisbeth Chirinos
Reviews.Content: Grabber is an excellent tv. The only bad thing is that decoders capture low quality because the image is distorted to reach the computer.

Reviews.Title: It works with Ulead, but was not working well with Windows Movie Maker.
Reviews.Author: Letsclique
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I got the right driver online for my Windows 7 64 bit OS. It does work on Ulead software, but it was flickering when I was trying to use it as a webcam on Windows Movie Maker.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Wjc235711
Reviews.Content: This capture card is absolutely amazing for the price, The video quality is descent, However the audio is pretty bad... But hey, it's only 8 bucks.  I think its worth it, i just strip my videos of the audio and put music over it.

Reviews.Title: works fine for the price
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly due to the cheap price and to see how well it actually worked. I never planned to use it as my main video capture device, as I have a Canopus ADVC-100 firewire box to capture my video.The product arrived fine. It wasn't damaged in any way. While unpacking it I could definitely tell how cheap the quality of it was. I actually easily could pull the housing apart and see the inside of it. It did come with Ulead VideoStudio though which is nice I guess. I didn't install it as some reviewers said it doesn't work well, plus I already have software I use to capture. I did try out Windows Media Encoder though at 640x480 and it worked fairly well. Like I said, it's cheap, what do you expect?Overall, I would say it is definitely not a great card to use for video capturing, but for the price, its fine.

Reviews.Title: Works Great after working out the Vista bug
Reviews.Author: RickWilliams86
Reviews.Content: I love this capture device had a small problem with the laptop since it was running Vista but once I tracked down the driver it worked perfect.

Reviews.Title: It's a useless piece of plastic,doesn't include proper drivers
Reviews.Author: Jose Aguirre "STORM777"
Reviews.Content: I followed the instructions step by step per directions on the included paper and also per customer review guidance and NOTHING,So I noticed that the damn driver it's installing is a UB Grabber 2.0 and NOT the STK1150 Driver. I wasted 2-3 hrs going from site to site,forum to forum trying every solution on earth and NOTHING.The driver seems to be non-existent and since the cheap packaging was completely plastic .. NOW I'm stuck with a piece of plastic that looks like it does something.... SMH

Reviews.Title: memory
Reviews.Author: dannevis
Reviews.Content: It worked fine after a long process to figure out how to get input to laptop---then it used 21gb of memory in less than an hour advice on how to format for less memory use!!

Reviews.Title: works
Reviews.Author: Scotty Gilliam
Reviews.Content: Yes, it does work well. Make sure you use an s-video cord unless you want horrible quality. And play with the settings of the software to suit your use; the software works just fine for most anyone's purpose. [I used this to record xbox360 saved videos]

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: davige
Reviews.Content: Showed up in my system info as a SM-USB 007 which, if you do some research, is a bootleg EasyCAP device. Software CD would not load in my drive. Sent back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work at all.
Reviews.Author: Rattle_The_Cages "-rattle"
Reviews.Content: This does not work at all.  And the neither does the included software.  I should not have discarded the packaging so I could return it.

Reviews.Title: it doesn't work
Reviews.Author: yt
Reviews.Content: this item is not real work. it did capture some of the image, but lost the quality of video. so it is not recomment to other customer.

Reviews.Title: It's ehh..
Reviews.Author: bbqpaul
Reviews.Content: I like it a lot, but I think the installation was too much of a hassle. I mean, in the package the included a CD which included Ulead Video Studio in which I can start camming. However, I couldn't really start due to the missing drivers. The CD did not provide a driver and so I to go look up some random website in hoping that there's a driver that makes it compatible with Windows 7 32 bit. In which, I did find it luckily. After I purchased all the other components, I tested it and it worked like a charm. Though the quality isn't completely the best, it's still great to play video games and record my gameplay at the same time.Rating scale:Sending + Packaging: 4/5CD + Installation: 1/5Ease of access: 4/5Capturing Quality: 3/5So in overall: 3 (It's okay)

Reviews.Title: Good hardware, Terrible software
Reviews.Author: Jake Harris
Reviews.Content: Good product and good price. Works for surveillance and making digital copies of vhs etc. Provides a sound and video input for your computer. The device itself is decent and works but is made of somewhat cheap materials.Do NOT use the included software!!! It is oversized, cheap, cheesy, and extremely buggy. Chances are that it will not install properly due to redundancies in the code. The driver on the included disk works, the rest does not.Use windows media encoder! It is free and runs the device very well. You may need to still install the driver from the disk but don't waste your time trying to install the software that is included. I tried several other programs of the company that made the included software but all were pricey, large, and didn't run the capture card. Use Windows Media Encoder and save yourself a lot of time and effort.

Reviews.Title: overall worth the money
Reviews.Author: only squirrel in the world
Reviews.Content: overall satisfied with thte device itself, however, the capture program that comes with it, will not install properly due to a cabinet file error. theres other software out there that can do the same though.if you want to capture video, i would suggest this product, but dont try to install thte software, it's a waste of time, just install the drivers and find another video capture program.

Reviews.Title: You might be buying a DEFECTIVE product
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: The following forum explains why you might be getting ripped off on this purchase[...]To summarize it, there are two different computer chips in the EasyCAP.One variety is known by the models numbers STK1150 or STK1150, built by a company called Syntek. These work with the appropriate drivers, which are a bit of a chore to track down, but apparently can be found.The other variety identifies as "SM-USB 007" or "SMI Grabber DEV" when plugged in and installing drivers. This one does not appear to support audio capture, or does not have the drivers necessary. You must patch the red and white RCA coming out of the device you have your video tape in into a microphone jack. These adapters are available from more electronic boutiques, but the audio quality can suffer.In the end, you may be advised to go with the EZCap instead, as it is the genuine product to which this is a knock-off.TL;DR Some of these EasyCAPs are made with inferior parts and software and are nigh impossible to patch around. You're running a gamble this.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Sterling F.
Reviews.Content: As long as you follow the included instructions and install the software before plugging in the EasyCap, you should have no issues. I've transferred 5 VHS tapes so far with absolutely no issues. There are lots of video quality options to tweak and experiment with in the Ulead VideoStudio that is provided on the disc. Only advice, close the program and restart it once you've made a change as it seem to have issues making changes on the fly. If you're looking for an insanely inexpensive ($7!?!) way to transfer VHS tapes to digital format, I can't think of a better option.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and functional - poor video quality
Reviews.Author: Shadowclown
Reviews.Content: Installation was not a smooth process, but I got it installed. Driver files are not on the CD, you have to run the program to extract them to your computer. My only complaint at this price point is that video quality is very poor. Otherwise, it works though.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT WITH WINDVR3
Reviews.Author: ITS GREAT!!!
Reviews.Content: SOO I DECIDED TO GIVE IT A TRY AND WHEN I GOT IT I STARTED RECORDING GAME PLAYS BUT IT WAS TOO LAG. I WAS USING WINDOWS MOVIE MAKER AND I THOUGHT I WAS THE WORTS THING I BOUGHT BUT THEN I USE WINDVR 3 AND I STOP THE LAG. BEST THING I EVER BOUGHT .I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS.

Reviews.Title: NOT new.. Not In Original Packaging  and BROKEN.
Reviews.Author: dday
Reviews.Content: It stated this was new, it was in a little plastic baggy without the original packaging, the item was already broken at the seams and does not work.  Not worth my trouble to send back and definitely a reminder not to buy on this site again!.

Reviews.Title: Easycap usb
Reviews.Author: Larry Childress
Reviews.Content: Works great, not a bad price to also! buy it an keep on hand, if you're like me saving all those old vhs home movies to put on dvd's you want be sorry... that you got one of these to keep around the office or at home!

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: rjeii2 "rjeii2"
Reviews.Content: Poor video quality and recording but the device does work. Not for high quality video but great for camera input.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: T. Pham "Twee"
Reviews.Content: I read review and saw that some say yes, some say no, so I decided to take a chance and tried it out.  Big mistake.  Strongly not recommended fro anyone to use.  The product definitely not working as it claims to do.  Then when I uninstalled the software, it crashed my laptop.  It took me 2 days to reformat my laptop and lucky enough that I know about computer.  Imagine those who doesn't know, it will be much worse.  No offense to the product company, but this is a piece of crap and they shouldn't even sell it on the market.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: North Sunny
Reviews.Content: The device driver and the application installed with no problem on my XP computer (with service pack 3). Here is a list of steps I did to make this thing work:1. Put the CD into the drive.2. Start the program the autorun specified. (I did not like the autorun feature so I turned it off on my computer; that's why I had to manually start that program.)3. Select to install the driver. Then I did whatever the installation program asked me to do (such as "plug the device in to a USB port".) Note that plugging in the device will cause Windows XP to popup a "Hardware Assistant" box. Ignore this box till next step.4. When the driver installation program finished, select "No, not this time" in the "Hardware Assistant" box under the question: "Can Windows connect to Windows Update to search for software?". Then select "Next". Then select the option "Install the software automatically" and click "Next". Click "Finish" to close this window.At this point the driver was installed. I could fire up my capturing program to capture images from a video source. I my case I hooked up an analog camera to the adapter. It worked on my first try.Next I installed the Ulead VideoStudio program from the autorun main menu. Following the directions to select language ("English"), then accept the license agreement. The installation went on smoothly. The only catch was that at a certain point the tool tips of some of the options in the program were in a different language (which I could not read.) I thought that was a bad sign. But I continued the installation and that type of inconvenience did not appear again.After the Ulead VideoStudio was installed I digitized some videos. The process was quite straightforward. I have not tested to write the video to a DVD. The options were there. I will follow up with the result of that operation.The "Quick Installation Guide" that came with the product was obviously written by some non-English speakers, but I could get the information out of it with no problem. Overall speaking, the product functioned as advertised, at least for me.July 13, 2011 Follow-up on DVD authorizing: I tried to digitize a VHS tape using a video tape player (Sanyo DA4Head Hi-Fi). I chose to output to DVD. I used the default parameters except that I changed the quality setting to 100 (the highest value allowed). The process finished smoothly, and the created DVD is of very high quality. Other people mentioned that this device overheated during use. My digitizing process lasted for more than two hours, and the thing was still not even warm. My room temperature was 75 degrees. I am very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Drivers may be an issue but worth the trouble
Reviews.Author: J. Randolph Cooper
Reviews.Content: Once I finally found the drivers for Windows 7 64-bit got this to thing to work. Really cool! Turns any standard point and click cam (if you have an A/V cable) into a webcam. Great for Justin.tv or Ustream.com!

Reviews.Title: Works Great! had issues installing though.
Reviews.Author: Resistance117
Reviews.Content: This item had worked great coming from out of the box! i had issues but nothing i couldn't fix. this product is designed to take composite {Red, White, and Yellow cables} (and S-video) and allow you to record this at whatever resolution it is set to (also depending on if it is S-video, or Composite) and allows you to save it to a playable media that can be uploaded, and watched.Pros*Great for what it is needed for, and works straight out of the box! *For such a small cost ($8 USD) i really couldn't say no despite the negative reviews.  *worked perfectly, and my system recognized it (windows 7 64 bit) almost immediately.Cons*Audio is being difficult *Overheating is a definite issue with this product  *installation was very annoying, especially with the softwareIssues with hardware/software:1st, i had issues installing the driver because it was made for Windows XP, all you have to do is either just install the driver and update it by going to Computer(right click)->manage->Device manager-> (find Easycap {also known as USB Grabber [or some variation]}) and just update the driver by letting it search it online.2nd issue, this was annoying because it's a little inconvenient for me, but this product's software was only installed when i put it to the USB ports in the back of my desktop and to enter the serial code for the product, i had to use the numbers found ON TOP OF THE LETTERS AND UNDERNEATH THE F KEYS ( such as F1, F2, etc...).3rd issue, despite the holes found on the outer shell of the casing, this item will get overheated and will affect audio. so the best thing to do is just to  remove the case.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------other than those few issues (and some other minor ones) i would definitely recommend this item to any person who wants to capture and device  with a AV output. will do business again. (also i purchased the HDE version)

Reviews.Title: Works for what I wanted it for
Reviews.Author: Master Link
Reviews.Content: This product, when purchased, cost me less than $10. I got it so I can play some of my games while my girlfriend steals my TV while she is over. The sound quality for them is horrible, but luckily I have a pair of Trittons I bought a few months back. I have mostly used my PS2 with it and just use my Trittons for the sound. So far, haven't had too many problems with it. A bit of lag issues to begin with, but quickly found better drivers with the help of Google. After that, worked like a charm. Wouldn't suggest if you are gonna use it on the PS3 or Xbox 360, but seems to work fairly well for my PS2, Wii, and Dreamcast.

Reviews.Title: What they don't tell you...
Reviews.Author: Emanuel Brown
Reviews.Content: Before you buy this product, let me tell you the part they didn't tell you. If you go back to the manufacturer's website, you will find that there are multiple versions of nearly identical products. The difference between them is the Operating system that they are compatible with. WARNING!! This one only works with Microsoft XP and earlier. It does not work on VISTA. I have not tried it on Windows 7, but I have tried on Visa. If you have Vista, do not buy this product. There is another version on the manufacturer's website for a slightly more expensive version that works on multiple operating systems including Vista. Buy that one for $14/15 dollars not this one. However, if you are running XP, you should be fine with this product.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Old guy
Reviews.Content: Worthless for the average computer user. Maybe a computer ace can make it work. I should have spent the money on a burger & fries.

Reviews.Title: Does Not Support Windows 7 But Found Way Around
Reviews.Author: Bruce Turner "Bruce T."
Reviews.Content: Well at first I was a little frustrated because whenever i would put the cd in it would open or install to later find out it does not support Windows 7. After finding a video on youtube for device i was able to install the driver without the cd very simple and great. Have had great satisfaction with Easycap so far besides a little static noise in the background, no big deal tho. Highly suggest for people who stream tv or video games. Also suggest using a vcr so you dont have to connect system directly to pc.

Reviews.Title: Great product...but missing an adapter
Reviews.Author: Joseph A. Bordage "Joe"
Reviews.Content: This device works.  I'll start there because I was able to figure out how to make everything work eventually.  So, after installing the included software, right out of the box it worked.  It captured video and it seemed like everything was working.  However on playback, the sound was unusable.  After some internet research, I discovered that the USB connection for audio does not work on all PC's...and in this case a Compaq 700US laptop.  To make the sound usable, you need to use the line-in on the PC (MIC input).  Basically, you need to purchase a phono to RCA adapter like this one:[...]Next, you take your source audio and plug into the adapter and go into the line-in port.  On the software, you need to then select that as your audio source.  The video still uses the USB.Now the image quality isn't the best.  I noticed that fast action was clipped on playback.  Luckily, this was for taking some kids shows off my DVR and making a DVD for a recent trip with my 2-year-old.  She's not that concerned with image quality (yet).The rendering from the captured show took quite a while on my older laptop.  About 2 hours for a 22 min show.  I'm sure with a better PC this would have been faster.So, in short...this product works, but you have to play with it and when it does, the image/sound quality isn't the same as your source material.  But, it works!

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. Good for recording, great quality! I will be making gameplays of cod games with this on utube. YOUTUBE- Azell1998

Reviews.Title: Works Fine, When and If You Get It Installed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews for this but I bought it anyway because I wanted an easy solution for my wife to transfer some old VHS tapes to the computer (and ultimately DVD). I had used Premiere Pro CS4 before, but I hoped this would be an easier solution for since she didn't really need any fancy editing options.When the item arrived it was in the typical shrink plastic (i.e. not Frustration-Free) packaging. I opened it up and tried to install it. The software that came on the CD had all kinds of issues. It would start to install, but then fail in the process. This happened many times. Finally, I turned to the internet and started looking for the manufacturer's website. This was when I realized what another reviewer pointed out; there are a lot of fakes out there right now. I wasn't sure if I had a fake or just a bad software CD. So I downloaded what appeared to be the right software from the website.It was not "Easy". It was not quick. I had to play with it a bit and do some searching on the internet to get this thing to work. Had I simply handed this to my wife and let her install it, she would have sent it back (she is technology proficient, but does not have the desire or the patience to trouble shoot these type of issues).Once I got this thing installed (and we are talking a few hours of trouble shooting on a Saturday morning), it worked fine. The video files are large if you set it to AVI. If you set it to MPEG they get smaller and still look good. My wife has used this since to transfer VHS tapes to the computer and I then edit them and put them on DVD (with Premiere).So, if you have the patience and the know-how regarding how to get this up and running, this will work for you. If you do not, don't bother with this. Spend more money and get something that works out of the box. I gave this three stars because when I got it working, it worked fine. However, I could have easily given it 1 star based on the fact that it was nearly impossible to install and get working.-Cheers!

Reviews.Title: bad product all-round
Reviews.Author: Sherlock Ramses
Reviews.Content: Got the product today, and tried to install it. I was able to install the driver, but not the video software. I kept getting some data check(cyclic redundancy check) error. Googled it to see how to handle it, nothing. Called the customer support, and they were rude/short.It costs $8, you shouldn't expect a high-quality product. There's a $20 video card that I plan on ordering from amazon. Buy that one if you can, it may be better quality just because of the price.

Reviews.Title: Frustration in a box
Reviews.Author: ChrisGeek
Reviews.Content: I had nothing but trouble with this thing. I bought 4 of them hoping they would all work together on the same PC, but it was a pain just to get one of them to work. The CD that it comes with has the wrong registration code. I had to search the internet for a different code, I finally fond one that worked and let me install the software. Even then, not many of my apps detected it as a video-in device. The drivers would only detect 1 at a time. I ended up throwing away all of them, as returning them would have costed more in shipping than they were worth.

Reviews.Title: A very good product to setup with patience
Reviews.Author: OJ
Reviews.Content: I hesitated before buying this product and also because of some negative reviews but I am very satisfied with it. So far, I already recorded more than 100 GB videos (from my TV and from Internet)!It took me 4 days before I was able to make it work. Not because of the product itself, but because there is little guidance on how to setup the device.The other important cause of failure to setup this device is related to your computer USB 2.0 technology itself. My IBM lenovo x61s has 3 USB ports. While setting the device, I noticed that the 3 USB ports of my computer are not the same :- USB port 1 : doesn't work with the product (I see strange lines on the screen but no real images from my TV);- USB port 2 : works but images are black/white - there is no color;- USB port 3 : it works fine with very good color images.Before you blame the product, please take time to try the different USB ports of your computer first. Make sure that on the settings, you select the device and choose NTSC. If you want to schedule recordings you may need NCH softwares because the AMCAP software that comes with the product is just for basic functions.

Reviews.Title: For Video its fine, Audio is a disaster
Reviews.Author: BlueMagican "Blue"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product as a way to stream video games and capture video from my camcorder.  I honestly didn't expect it to work at all however the picture from my PS2 actually looked better through it then it did using the piggy back cables that I have going to my 19" HD TV.  It's my belief that it looks better because the PS2 is a standard definition system, and the device captures standard definition.  I noticed no only minor lag in the picture, but it wasn't so much as to make the game "Super Ghouls and Ghosts" on the Capcom Classics Collection Vol. 1 unplayable.I am running Windows 7 64 Bit Home Premium with a 6 core, AMD Phenom II X6 1045 T Processor running at 2.7 Ghz.  I have 6 GB of installed ram, an on board sound card, and some nice Logitech speakers. System is less then 6 months old as a matter of fact.The audio however on the device is 100% failure, as is the included USB extension cable.  In fact the extension cable is toast straight out of the packaging, completely unusable, since no devices I plug into it work, no matter what I plug in, or the USB port used,  however when the same items are plugged into the same ports they work just fine.  The audio on the device is horrendous.While you DO get sound through the device, its sounds like a very badly tuned radio full of static, stuttering sounds artifacts, and worse, if your in a section where there is no music you get a horrendously loud buzzing which gave me a near instant headache from the pitch as oscillation.  There are work arounds to fix this, but it takes purchasing another program, using the line in port on your computer (with a rca to mini 3.5 jack cable), or if you want to do voice over work a external mixer plugged into your line in port, while using a RCA to 3.5 mini cable.  The fact of the matter is that the sound quality is completely unacceptable, and unusable making this product only partly functional.However the product IS functional, and because of the price (I got it for free, normally its 20 dollars but I had credit with Amazon), I will keep it until I can afford better.  Considering I wasn't expecting the product to work at all, I am impressed with its quality, however it is disappointing that the product is only 50% functional.  I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: This item was FAKE
Reviews.Author: Misty Manning
Reviews.Content: I bought this easycap for my son and when it got to our house it was in a box wrapped in bubble wrap and part of the wires were coming out.  It was not in it's original packaging, and when we selected this item it stated that it was "NEW"!  I've never been so dissatisfied with a purchase from Amazon, I've always had such great luck with all my other purchases through Amazon.  Buyer beware, this item might be a fake!

Reviews.Title: EasyCap isn't "easy"
Reviews.Author: ajbair
Reviews.Content: I had my doubts about this product after reading the reviews, but since the price was low enough, I though I'd give it a try. It seemed simple enough - plug it in and load the software, but after about two hours of trying to get it to work, I gave up. My time is worth more than the price of the product. If I have to call a computer tech to come out and figure it out, I guess it's not so cheap after all. I not sure what someone would charge to transfer Hi8 videos to DVD, but I think it's probably worth it. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT. EasyCap is cheap because it sucks.

Reviews.Title: Great product...
Reviews.Author: Cry
Reviews.Content: Product lives up to its promises.  In addition to the provided software, I am using the Microsoft Movie Maker to copy the video to my machine.  Very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Analog VHS to Digital
Reviews.Author: leon
Reviews.Content: The USB connector works great and the price is right.  I am having trouble saving edited projects.  If goes through the process and then fails.

Reviews.Title: Not the best but it gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to get my old VHS tapes on my Vista 32-bit computer. The software was a pain to install and to configure. The quality of the tapes is mediocre but seeing that most of my tapes are old and fading its not a big deal. If your planning on getting this for capturing high quality stuff then save your money for something else.

Reviews.Title: Simple & Easy Solution
Reviews.Author: ScottNYC
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to find a way to copy old VHS tapes to my computer for a while. This product made it very easy to get this done. The editing software that comes with it is weak, but it does work... besides, you can use different software to edit. For me, it was about a quick and easy way to get my old videotapes into a digital form - and this product works like a charm!Scott Gilbert[...]

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: Mr. Woody
Reviews.Content: don't waste your money on this.  It is a fake and a piece of junk, and I'm sorry to say I bought one to test them out.

Reviews.Title: Not the Best Buy, but a good Buy
Reviews.Author: Darrell Williams
Reviews.Content: It's a good product for the amount of money.  It works.  It's not the best quality, but it works.  Very simple to use on a laptop or netbook.  Perfect for baby monitoring and nanny cams.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says
Reviews.Author: Cameron Frank
Reviews.Content: I went ahead on and gave this fella 5 stars because it does exactly what it says it does. Captures 480p video, and pretty good audio with a pretty simple interface. I will say, the software that comes with it was not exactly optimal for what I was using it for(to screen capture a friend playing Call of Duty) but if you're just converting old home videos and such, this should be perfect.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to record gameplay videos for my machinima contract after my dazzle broke. I was extremely unsatisfied, as it creates lines when the screen move quickly, and the sound quality is terrible. You get what you pay for. Something cheap.

Reviews.Title: Easy Cap Review
Reviews.Author: The Smeltz
Reviews.Content: For 14 bucks (shipping, handling, and product), this is a good product. If you're looking for amazing quality, then you have to spend more on a different high end product. But to the price, the Easy Cap does what it is supposed to do...  Record (with a few skips between your clips because it's too slow.) But for what it's worth, this product is alright.  I am keeping mine but I will probably get a different brand of nicer quality.TS

Reviews.Title: Don't bother with this one
Reviews.Author: Steve Lewis "Music Man Steve"
Reviews.Content: I Figured for less than 10 dollars I can have a pretty good capture device to go from my Cable DVR to my computer so I can save shows I recorded before changing converters. NOT.... Although I believe that this device works to a degree it is really garbage. After spending hours loading, reloading drivers and the application I could get nothing but a jumpy picture and I had to use my sound card for the audio. After reading some reviews of this item I saw that it was most likely a bogus imitation of the excap tv adaptor which was a bit more money but still reasonable (under 40 dollars).I returned the easycap and bought an ezcap.tv. The difference is night and day. It took a matter of minutes to install on windows 7 64 bit and within less than 1/2 hour I was recording high quality video. Do yourself a favor and get the better one.Steve

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: HDProdigy
Reviews.Content: It works just fine, if you have trouble installing there are tutorials all over the place. Use the SVIDEO cable for optimal quality.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay :-/
Reviews.Author: Tess "Tess L."
Reviews.Content: *NOT A FAKE REVIEW. I'M A REAL BUYER*I bought this so I could record game play on the XBOX 360. I thought this would be enough but I realized that when you plug in the audio cables into EasyCap, you're left with no sound which makes it hard for certain games like Call Of Duty when you rely on audio to help win the game.Set up was easy. I had no trouble with that.I haven't recorded anything before so maybe it's just me but I could only record 320 x 240 MPEG videos and that's not good quality. Anything else would either freeze, lag, or get fuzzy at certain times.Whenever I opened up the program that came with this, it would change my computer display settings because the program is kind of old. (I have Windows Vista)I usually had to press record twice because the first time I pressed it, it would stop at 1 second. Then the second time it would record without stopping.If I could record good quality videos and not have my display settings change every time I opened the program EasyCap came with, this product would the best for a low price.It's okay for now but I'll definitely buy another recording device.

Reviews.Title: Works great on XP - You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Jared S. "DNA easy"
Reviews.Content: I think this is a bargain, I think most reviewers who gave neg. feedback are novice PC users. The device is a pain to setup, (have to check you PAL/NTSC settings etc..) but once configured and drivers installed it works awesome. I hooked it up to a 90's camcorder and Ustream'ed a bunch of baseball games (2-4 hrs each) and the unit always worked. Picture is better than my $70 hd webcam! If you are tech savy pick this item up, if you have never edited a registry or configured your routers firewall spend more money and get a product dumbed down for you.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: DON'T BUY THIS!  It may convert a VHS to a digital file, but it's too huge to put on one DVD!  I converted "An American Tale" and the digital playback was slow, jumpy and the audio was horrible (lots of feedback and white noise that was not present when played on the VCR).  And I had to watch it directly on my computer because I didn't have enough DVD-Rs to burn it and watch it on my DVD player.  Sad day when I realized I wasted a gift card on this...

Reviews.Title: EasyCap USB 2.0 is great value
Reviews.Author: Woodman
Reviews.Content: I bought the EasyCap video capture device 2 months ago and have found it and the included Ulead Videostudio Software to be an incredible value, doing a great job capturing and editing old VHS tapes. I was hesitant to make the purchase after reading mixed reviews expressing numerous issues (counterfeiting,hardware recognition or loading driver,audio syncronization,and others). Amazon uses different venders which adds another variable - I rate my supplier,"WowParts", as reliable. No problem for me loading the driver and software (my system = Athlon 2200 processor, 1.25G RAM, XP operating system). Using the software was and still is a learning experience as I continue to discover the sofisticated capabilities of the Ulead Videostudeo program. For anyone thinking of purchasing the EasyCap device I would suggest reading reviews and watching tutorials and sift through the various opinions out there to make a reasoned decision. To get this product for under $9 was unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: Cheap way to transfer all of your VHS recordings
Reviews.Author: J. WU "sector001"
Reviews.Content: I had wanted an inexpensive way to transfer my old VHS store bought videos, my $3000 Sony PC, wouldn't let me transfer it over because of copy protection, but this $8 device let me do what I wanted to do. I first tried to install it on my Windows 7 laptop, it didn't work, I don't think it works with Windows 7, so I installed it on my Dell XP desktop, it works with XP. after it successfully installed on my xp machine, I proceeded to transfer some tapes to the HD. It works great, only thing bad is that it has to be done in real time. So far I have transferred 5 VHS tapes to the HD already.buy this if you don't want to lose your VHS tapes.....

Reviews.Title: Great but should be Temporary capture card
Reviews.Author: Redal
Reviews.Content: I recently got this product, for 8$ it is a steal, but for a product your going to use for DVD's and Lets play it shouldn't be your first pick.1.The first problem that came up with this product was that the easycap CD drivers are out of date for windows 7 and windows vista, as far as I know, so I went on google and searched for drivers, it was easy, the video showed up great at a AVI format, but takes up alot of space, my recommendation if your going to buy it download video pad and put it as a mp4 or mov format.2. The Easycap makes buzzing sounds!  no its not your audio, the easycap makes this audio because it was poorly made, and it over heats easily, this makes it almost impossible to even consider burning a DVD, and to add onto it you have to mess with the computers volume to get the audio to work right for your  videos. Overalll if your planing to use it for a dvd, then get a better card3. The one BIG problem is that it reboots the computer if your using the easycap, so to prevent this do not, I repeat DO NOT DISCOUNT WHILE IT IS SHOWN ON YOUR RECORDING SCREEN make sure you exit before you turn off the easycap and the gameThis product is good non the less, you get what you paid for, its cheep for what I got it 8$,  I can't recommend it as a GREAT product, but  I can recommend it as a temporary video card, intill you can get a dazzle or another more expense product, in this case price does count.overall though, it is great for the cheap consumer

Reviews.Title: Easy Cap USB 2.0
Reviews.Author: chet
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this item, and have found it to be completely useless with out the register key that was suppose to accompany the product.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: I liked it, was easy to install on my computer, and very easy to use, it's very small, almost like a pendrive :) and the capture quality si very good.

Reviews.Title: not as esey as it looks
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: I  tried to get it to sinc with my computer . but it wont recognize it  the program disk was hard to navigate . still working on using it  . have not had time.

Reviews.Title: Steer away from this piece of crap
Reviews.Author: M. W. Pinter "Mike Pinter"
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is a product with poor quality control, as there are a few people with positive reviews, but sadly my experience falls under with the majority of poor reviews.  The Software was easy to install and use, but no matter what I did, the video would come across fine but the audio was terrible.  I tried several reboots, reinstalls, and on 3 different video sources (DVR, VCR and Camcorder.  The video always worked, but the audio failed.  Finally, I bought a separate RCA to headphone jack and plugged my sources audio into the mic jack of my PC.  The software allowed me to do this and I was able to capture the video & audio.  That was another $10, but still made it cheaper than some of the $50 capture devices.If you buy this - good luck.  I hope you get one of the good ones.

Reviews.Title: Windows (x64) users stay away from this!
Reviews.Author: ChipnHolly
Reviews.Content: This product does NOT work with Windows 7 x64. The video capture works great, however, after several hours of fighting with the audio and searching the web I found numerous others who had the same problem, no audio and no hope that it will ever work. This product is a cheap Chinese knockoff of a much better product.I wasted a lot of time. Don't be that guy (me). Just spend a little extra money and buy this:[...]

Reviews.Title: Driver challenge
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I received the product which was advertised as Vista-compatible.  There were no vista drivers available with the delivered product.  After much research I found suitable drivers on the Internet.  Seems to be a decent product but have not used it much yet.

Reviews.Title: Works with some effort.(And on Windows 7.)
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: This item is a classic case of 'You get what you pay for'. When the EasyCAP arrived my first impression was that it is smaller in person than I'd thought. Pictures on the Web are not to scale, I guess. I tried to install as per the instructions, which were jumbled and confusing. When I put in the CD I was given a window with the contents of the disc on it, and spent about 30 mins. looking through it for the installer. I eventualy found it and installed succesfuly, but when I tried to record I got a message saying that my screen res. was too small for the recorded video to play. The requirement was 1024x768, mine(on an XP laptop) was 1024x764. Four pixels less than needed.Great. I then tried to install on my Windows 7, which took even longer, only to find out that the driver controling the EasyCAP didn't install, leaving me unable to use the device. I spent a while looking for drivers and tutorials on the Web, eventualy finding one on YouTube. It worked, but the audio is terrible.Now I have to buy a device which converts audio output to microphone input so I can finally use my EasyCAP to the fullest. Overall a PASSABLE product.

Reviews.Title: Easy Cap Works Better With Other Software
Reviews.Author: Paulie
Reviews.Content: I installed the drivers without problem and the device detected fine on a Win7 pc.I installed the Ulead software no problem also.The serial number was on a little instruction sheet.The software is poor and cumbersome to use.The sound quality thru the adapter is very bad.Probably because the hardware listing for the audio indicates its using the microphone input.Huh?That problem was solved using the audio input on the pc.The software problem was solved downloading the free video capture software [...].Debut works like you would expect.I used a s-video source from a Fios receiver and quality was good on captures.

Reviews.Title: Works Good On INTEL Macs And Pc's
Reviews.Author: mukul
Reviews.Content: MY NO BS REVIEW:On my windows xp pc it took like an hour to set upOn my macintoish computer it took 15 minsPc instructions: Install ALL THREE DRIVERS (in order) then restart fire it up and customize the settings to allow video and audio (there no single settings you have to play around with it)Mac instructions:Install VideoGlide Log out or restart and log back in and open video glide go to custom size and make it 1280 by 720 and you have HD!i use this to make my videos on my youtube:[...]

Reviews.Title: Didn't work at all
Reviews.Author: IZbraun
Reviews.Content: I tried installing the software twice for this product but never seemed to work.  There's a little green indicator light on the device that I assume is supposed to light up when plugged into the computer but it never did.  I guess I may have gotten a defective one??

Reviews.Title: EasyCap
Reviews.Author: CoolBeans112
Reviews.Content: Ok, first off I'm a real purchaser of the easycap. Second off let me start of by saying it does work. However I do believe this is a clone product because the plating around the red, yellow, and white av composite is silver and I've read real ones have gold, and the usb color on the inside is black and I've read it's supposed to be white. Despite this it works as if it was an original. This product works just as well as a Dazzle or any other expensive Capture Card. I'm extremely satisfied with what I got. However there are a few things that bugged me, it didn't come in an original packaging, it came in a box inside the box was a sealed bag with bubble wrap around the Easycap and the usb extension cord, and the CD inside a paper cd holder. The usb extension cable that comes with it is USB 1.1 therefore you can't use it, you have to plug the easycap directly into your laptop or computer. You can't play in HD and record in SD despite what you may have read, I've spent several hours trying to accomplish this, and I'm very computer-literate. The Quality you can get with your videos is very good, some people have gotten it to look like HD in some videos I've seen on youtube. I recommend Googling a guide on settings, because with the default settings you'll get a comb effect on your videos. Sorry if this review is unorganized, I'm just trying to give people an idea of what your getting from a real purchaser.PS: I use this with my Xbox 360PSS: heres one of my videos if you don't believe me[...]

Reviews.Title: No Serial Code
Reviews.Author: No Serial
Reviews.Content: I got this EasyCap in the mail a week ago.So over the weekend i go to install software from the disk to find you need a Serial Code.I Searched everything i recived and found there was no serial code anywere so it come to i dont have the software or serial code nowDO NOT BUY THIS!

Reviews.Title: needs a little work
Reviews.Content: I got this really only for video game capture,it was a pain at first the driver needed to be updated then the updated I first found was bad,I had to got to you tube to find drivers that worked.Then the quality wasn't all that great so I had to buy a compatible xbox cable w/ s video.that was only 12 bucks though but more money spent on a supposed stand alone item.The ulead software that comes w/ it is ok but there is some conflict between hardware driver and software drivers because it wont capture sound.I have been using Magix Video recorder and it seems to work ok until you try and record at 720p.The standard software will record at 720p but no sound.To get the sound working you have to buy another adapter witch plugs into your mike jack on your pc,laptop.Then the sound works.Outside of these annoyances and once I got all the drivers right,plus hardware it works so if your looking for a cheap capture card you found it just be ready to put in a little time in finding a compatible driver,and sound jack adapter then your good.It will capture video game content and be decently clear for games like Call of duty or other first person shooter's Sports games not so good characters are to small.w/ that being said it is what it is in comparision to other cards that cost more this will be a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: Junk - Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Irish Stu
Reviews.Content: Simply, this was junk.  After about three hours of trying different ways to configure the hardware and software I gave up.  I never was able to get a signal worth capturing, the video stream from the 4-head, stereo VCR was grainy to the point of being unrecognizable and there was no sound captured whatsoever.  Software installation was easy, but the software would hang on Windows XP SP2 for minutes at a time when selections were made from menus.  I would not recommend this item to anyone.

Reviews.Title: EasyCap may require tweaking...but definitely worth the cost !
Reviews.Author: S. Miller
Reviews.Content: I wanted a USB capture device that could record video and sound off of a Satellite Dish Receiver for my morning news broadcast...don't you hate those commercials?...essentially re-creating a laptop DVR. All computer hardware installs differently depending on your computers operating system, installed software and hardware configuration. Take any reviews on ease of installation with a grain-of-salt because it may take you 10 minutes to get the capture dongle to work correctly or 6 hours. I'm running Windows 7 on a Toshiba Satellite Duo Core Laptop with a realtek sound chip. I couldn't get the sound to work through the USB port (but many reviewers reported Vista & XP will working fine thru the USB)...not sure why except it's probably an incompatility issue with my sound chip and the provided drivers. It all depends on the type of computer you have.  Nevertheless I opted to use a RCA jack splitter and feed the sound outputs from the Dish receiver out-jacks into the stereo microphone input jack on the Laptop. I made a mistake of choosing the microphone setting instead of the CORRECT setting which was LINE IN...that cost me over an hour of anquish trying to figure out why the sound was so garbled.After a couple of hours of experimenting I did manage to get excellent quality video and sound by choosing regular screen format (unchecking the 6:9 box on the ULead software that is included with the USB capture device)and selected MPEG-2 with a 5000 bit sample rate.  This seemed to be a good compromise for video and sound quality without eating up too much of my hard drive space.  The default AVI setting can generate very large files and unless your have a system with tera-bytes of space it's best to consider using a image format that compresses the video thus lowering the picture quality and saving hard drive disk space.  The included Ulead software is a little dated but did work so long as you ignor the error screens and no sound preview while you are recording. I did get sound on playback mode only.I paid [...] for the EasyCap which includes the free 2-day shipping from Amazon and didn't expect miracles but was truely amazed with the great results from such an inexpensive product. If you enjoy tinkering with technology, as I do, then I highly recommend the EasyCap USB 2.0 Audio/Video Capture/Surveillance Dongle...a definite bang-for-the-buck bargain.

Reviews.Title: 4CH USB DVR
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Axley "Lost John"
Reviews.Content: Sweet All 4 Channel Work No Trouble With Getting It To Work It Ran My 4 CCTV Cam's While My Main DVD Recorder Was Being Repair From Reading Some Neg Comment. That What Made Me Wanted To Get This It Took Sometime To Search For The Cam's But When The Usb DVD Found Them Evrything Worked Fine. This Would Make A Sweet Gift For Anyone Who On A Low Buget. I Give It A Rateing Of 100% Save Me A Bundle. See Nothing wrong With It. Be Trying The VHS To DVD Tell You Later How It Went .Almost Forgot It Worked On My Laptop Running Windows Vista With No Problem.

Reviews.Title: Not Great
Reviews.Author: DA maN
Reviews.Content: The installation process was confusing but manageable. My USB extension was poorly built as it broke off on the first day of use. The only way I could get sound was by using VLC player and DScaler. Video quality isnt great. I didn't try the software that came packaged so I can't say if it's good or bad. Overall I might think about spending more money on a better video capture device.

Reviews.Title: Fake Product
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: I got this so i can record gaming videos. I was exited but when i went to install the disk it wouldnt install. It says that the program can't be found. Then i found out people are making fake EasyCAPS and selling them. So this doesnt happen to you look at these features.1. Is it over $20?2. Are the ends (female tips) Gold or silver? Silver= Fake Gold= Real3. Does it say EzCAP or EasyCAP?  EasyCAP= Fake EzCAP= Real4. Is the righting gold or white? White= Fake Gold= RealMake sure you get everything right before you buy an EasyCAP.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: AZJim
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time.  Tried on several different computers and the drivers never installed properly on any of them.  No online support etc.  Just take your money outside and set it on fire.

Reviews.Title: does not work as advertised
Reviews.Author: shell
Reviews.Content: The sound quality is horrible and the video skips many frames when trying to capture at the 480 resolution.  I switched to two different software packages, and tried it on three different computers,  but the sound quality was still horrible and the capture could not keep up and was dropping frames like crazy (dropping around 20 frames per second).  Would not recommend this.  I am returning this product because it did not perform as advertised.  PRoduct:  DC60 EASYCAP

Reviews.Title: Here is how to get it to work on Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Brett Rash "BMR"
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all you are going to want to find the Windows 7 Drivers. Here is a link (change the * to a . when entering it into your address bar) www*jaftek*com and download either the 32 or 64 bit driver (depending on your version of Windows 7). There is a video on that page that will show you how to install the drivers. However, here is the same instructions broken down into steps if that will make it easier.1) Download the proper drivers to your desktop (depending on your Windows 7 version)2) Plug your EasyCap into your USB port on your PC, it will search for drivers and fail (this is okay and may take a moment)3) Right Click your "Computer" icon and click on Properties4)On the Left side of the Properties screen click on Device Manager5) You should see USB Interface Device (or something along those lines with a Yellow Triangle. Right click on that and click Update Driver Software.6) Windows will ask if you want it to Search automatically or Browse the computer. Click on Browse my computer for driver software.7) On the next screen direct it to search your desktop by click Browse and then clicking Desktop, then okay.8) Click Next and let it search (it may take a couple minutes). As it's installing the driver Windows may say the driver is "potentially dangerous" but just install, it's just a precaution built into the Windows Operating System.9) After it is installed close the window and your EasyCap will now have the proper driver and will be ready to use!If you have any questions leave a comment on this review and I will get back to you as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: It works but it is a lot of work.
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: I got it to work on Vista 32 (barely).  The software it comes with is ok at best.  I still have to mess with it to get it to work.  I got it to record VHS to MPG.  I got one or two lower quality formats to work also but not all of them. I use Window's move maker to edit and save. The adapter is great, it works. It is the software that is the problem.  If you know of alternate video capture applications, then I'd buy the adapter and pitch the CD that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: Not too shabby..
Reviews.Author: Amber B. Cox
Reviews.Content: My son bought this to do montages for his Xbox 360 and uses it quite often. It works great, the software that it comes with isn't the greatest, but for $10 I won't complain. It's definitely not as high def as some of the more expensive or internal capture cards, but it does get the job done, and can be used on other software for high def output. The engineering design isn't the greatest. It's a little back heavy so it's hard for the card to stay plugged into the USB as it wants to fall downward and slide out (luckily my USB bay is 2" deep) so it didn't fall out. I recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Simply Wonderful
Reviews.Author: HERMAN MOORE
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I actually bought a product that worked on the first try. It was compatible with my Windows 7 and immediately transferred my videos. I don't understand the negative reviews. I installed the drivers first and when I plugged up---voila!! Wonderful item at a wonderful price!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product For The Price
Reviews.Author: J. Dean
Reviews.Content: This product was easy to use with having a little knowledge in video editing software. It also works with any other video creating software. The only problem I had was you had to access the install by clicking setup files in the CD because the normal installation method would not work. Great product otherwise.

Reviews.Title: if using to record game consel gameplay, it is a hassal to set up
Reviews.Author: cmtrippen
Reviews.Content: if you are trying to record gaming consels it can be hard to set it up, and takes way to long to setup, but recording quality is worth it if you dont pay ove 10 dollars!!!

Reviews.Title: Installation disk came blank
Reviews.Author: Kevin Van Horne
Reviews.Content: I bought the EasyCap USB device, and as I heard it had problems with Win7, I used different drivers I found on the internet.  I can connect the device on Win7 and everything seems fine, although Roxio will see the video signal but not allow me to capture it.  However, when I decided to install it on my WinXP computer, then I discovered that the driver and software installation disk that came with the product was empty.  Nothing at all.  None of my computers would read it.  I checked and could see no scratches or anything, it just didn't work.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Not for me
Reviews.Author: H. W. Fitzgerald, Jr.
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about this device working OK with a Mac I bought it.  It works OK with a PC but not on a Mac.  I tried it on my iMac and my Power Book Pro, it did not work with either.  I tried it with different software using drivers that worked with my other two converts that do work with a Mac.  If one is going to use it with a PC then it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: READ THE REVIEWS, DO NOT BUY THIS
Reviews.Author: Youceff Kabal
Reviews.Content: Horrible product. I installed the codecs, reinstalled the codecs, reinstalled the application and the codecs AND restarted the computer but still can't get an image on the screen. There's a reason why it's so cheap: it doesn't function.

Reviews.Title: Hardware Works good, but I reckomend VirtualDub for gameplay recording
Reviews.Author: Ray.
Reviews.Content: At first the easycap worked like a dream, but after awhile the driver I downloaded kept crashing my hard drive.  If u have windows xp or vista you can use the drivers with this product. For windows 7 users, USE VIDEODUB FOR GAMEPLAY RECORDING! It is 100x times more better than using the easycap software.

Reviews.Title: Device = Bad...Software = Excellent
Reviews.Author: David Chew
Reviews.Content: I tried to get the device to work with my computer, but the audio was terrible. I might throw the device away. But the software that came with it was excellent! my videos are now in HD because of the software! The software is called ULead Video Studio SE DVD (which is really considered COREL) and it works!I would probably say skip the device, buy the software.

Reviews.Title: EasyCAP
Reviews.Author: Chandler Moore
Reviews.Content: I paid a total of [...] bucks for this capture device, so I didn't expect much of anything. After reading some of the reviews on here, I was surprised to find that the package was new and looked legit. The driver portion of the included CD was useless for me, and it was just easier to Google the Windows 7 drivers anyway. The CD comes with the capture software too, and I used that. The software is full of bugs and compatibility issues. I get an error every time I want to record something. I heard there's other software that's better, but I haven't tried it out yet. I tested this out recording gameplay videos from Tiger Woods 11 on Wii. Video quality is sub-par (pun intended) for a capture device, but fine for an $8 capture device. The picture is a little blurry, but not unwatchable. If you're looking for a cheap quick solution I would recommend this along with some composite splitters from eBay so you can split the signal to your TV. The whole set up only set me back $10, so I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: easy crap
Reviews.Author: Melvin R. Reed "mrreed1948"
Reviews.Content: the drivers that came with it dont work.the ulead software that came with it is useless with xp

Reviews.Title: If I could do zero stars I would
Reviews.Author: CecilSaxon
Reviews.Content: The item is a total waste of money. Drivers ON THE DISK crashed my system and I had to reinstall Windows. DO NOT TOUCH this thing. You are not special and yours will not work. All of the negative reviews are ACCURATE. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: Does not support Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Anthony A. Alvarez "Video Game Veteran"
Reviews.Content: I have recently purchased this product a week back and it's not that great. The reason being is that when I have installed this device onto my Windows 7 computer, the installation CD did not go through and the computer will not recognize the driver and the capture card. This is pure asinine and well, these products only support outdated operating systems which is bogus by the way.I would advise everyone to "think before you buy", because most capture cards are not compatible with Windows 7. Make sure you understand what operating system that theses capture cards support. Hopefully the manufacturers who make these products can enhance their drivers to Windows 7 compatibility.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jovian
Reviews.Content: It was trial and error getting this device to install on Windows Vista. However, once I got it properly installed it met my needs. I am unable to get the S-Video to work on my system, but, since I'm ripping home movies I really don't need perfection. The audio has static when using the devices input. Like many others I input my audio through an input built into my PC.

Reviews.Title: A useful gadget
Reviews.Author: Milan
Reviews.Content: Once you work out how to deal with it, the E-Cap becomes a very useful gadget. You may need to search the Internet to download the installation software, if the one that is provided does not work with your system (i.e. if you are using Win7). I also recommend not to use the USB for recording the sound, but better take a Y-splitter and plug it in the microphone jack, you'll get much better sound. I also find the provided ULead software pretty useful.So far, I've been using the E-Cap to transfer some of my old VHS tapes to my computer, and it worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: I wanted it just like you want it now
Reviews.Author: TennisBoy007
Reviews.Content: Hey guys,I bought this product from HDE about 2 and a half weeks ago. Wow, I was super stoaked about it!!! It arrived really fast. The only problem was the installation. I followed the instructions but there was a problem with the disk.  Everytime I restarted it, the same problem kepy occuring. So, I contacted the company and said I was really happy to get this but dissappointed that it didn't work. They happilly sent me a brand new disk. Today, I looked to see if it work and it did. So, if you buy this and your having problems with it, don't be afraid to send them a nice email.

Reviews.Title: Audio
Reviews.Author: Seant
Reviews.Content: The Easycap installed fairly easy and works okay. The audio is terrible. You have to download different drivers for the audio and finding one that works is a task. You may have to remove the casing because the unit overheats and causes the audio to having a horrible screeching noise. After you find the correct driver and remove the casing it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Quick Shipping
Reviews.Author: Media242
Reviews.Content: Thanks alot the product arrive faster than i thought, i got right in time (literally), good product easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Just as Described.
Reviews.Author: TypicalGirl
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of mixed reviews for this, most seeming to be disappointed the could not interface *from* their computer *to* a TV.This is a video capture device.I wanted to be able to stream live video from my laptop to the internet via a composite  or Svid camera. This is exactly what I needed.I have it installed both on a Vista PC and a Win 7 laptop and it installed easily. I didn't have any driver issues on Win 7. It comes with a software suite, but I'm capturing and broadcasting with either Adobe FlashEncoder or Windows Media Encoder (both free downloads).I hooked it up to a new 2.4GH wireless camera and can broadcast via my own webpage or sites like Justin.tv just fine. So, remembering that this device is meant to bring a video signal *into* your computer and not *out of* your computer, I can't find any fault with it.

This one is pretty much DOA.  It's recognized as a 160/120 device.  Capabilities are supposed to be 720/480.  This one is not recognized properly.I cannot reccomend this to anyone,

I recomended this seller and so soon i will purchase again with them. Reviews.Title: EasyCap

Reviews.Title: Fine Product
Reviews.Content: it worked fine recorded in color (xbox 360) and all you need to know is how to use computers and everything will ne fine btw the quality is great if you put it in movie maker and save it in 720p (if u wanna upload to youtube) if you wanna check out quality go  to [...]

Reviews.Title: Great Quality Great Price! Must Have!

Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically for Recording xbox360 gameplay for Modern Warfare 2 and other call of duty games. So far so good. This Came with a Installation Guide and a Disc for Software and Drivers. I Installed them very quickly < 20 minuets. I changed the recording settings for the program. So far no issues. everything workes as good as can be. Sad thing is i cannot record gameplay yet due to the fact that i am currently waiting on the Xbox360 Optical cables, with S-Video on it because mine does not currently have it. S-Video is by far better than the Red, White, Yellow Cords. The shipping was fast and in new condition. Comment if you got any questions.

Reviews.Title: software doesn't load, unable to use product

Reviews.Content: THe Unit arrived in good condition and very quickly, however the software would not work so the unit is worthless, I tried the install on two other computers I own , all with windows XP, none of them work, wondering if this product is not a scam.

Reviews.Title: EasyCap? More like PainInThe***Cap
Reviews.Author: Dolan
Reviews.Content: I would not suggest this for anyone just looking to plug and record. This easycap is given with the worst instructions, glitches, and other really dumb errors. It took me 3 hours just to figure out how to get the video to capture over ULead, and now im stuck with distorted audio. Get 30 more bucks and buy a dazzle.

Reviews.Title: Be careful...
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I heard about these EasyCap devices that allow you to record television and video-games.  I didn't do much research on them and just decided to buy one and test it out for myself despite some of the poor reviews.  Little did I know that there are MANY different versions and makers of this device and that some of them are fake or copied versions of the original EasyCap's made by a company called ForwardVideo.This device seemed to have some decent reviews and like some other buyers, I decided to give it a try since I have decent experience with computers and software and thought I could get it to work.  The first time I plugged it after installing the drivers and software and messing with some of the settings, I was able to get a full color, decent quality picture of Forza 3 that I was playing on my Xbox 360.  I started recording and when I went to play it back, the video was very choppy and the sound was out of sync.  I tried to record some television and the video still came out kind of choppy and the sound was fuzzy.  I decided to try again the next day but I was unable to because all of the sudden I couldn't get a picture no matter what source or cables I was using.  All I could see was a distorted green picture.  I tried reinstalling the software and drivers but that only made my computer slow and unresponsive.  I even tried using a different capture software but still got that distorted green picture.  I gave up and decided to send the product back.I wouldn't say that you should completely avoid this product all together because, if your lucky, you can probably get it to work with some patience and tinkering.  I decided to try and look for a newer version that my not have as many problems as this one.  If you have experience with electronics and computers and have some time, I say give it a try and you might get it to work.  If you don't have the time or patience, try something else.

Reviews.Title: Sound issues
Reviews.Author: Telstar
Reviews.Content: This worked in Win 7 64 bit.  I had to manually install it.  First install drivers...all of them in the 64 bit directory.  Then attach device.  It will not install.  Then go to the device manager under audio video and force installation.  Make the device manager look for new devices, then point it at the directory of the drivers.  You will have to fudge around to find the *real* audio driver.  To install this, you will need to go to sound in the control panel and then find installed sound devices.  Here also insist that you have a new sound device, and pick the obvious choice from the menu.  If you do not do this, the unit will work, but sound will not be be heard while you record (the sound will record, however).Simply put, if you have not fooled around with difficult and obtuse driver installations for media hardware, you will be totally frustrated and give up on this.Once installed, you can run this device in any compliant program, including Nero vision and the included Ulead (note that company no longer exists...it was bought out by Corel).The real problem is in the hardware, believe it or not after the above commentary.  The recorded sound has a 60 Hz feedback hum...ground loop.  This shows up most, of course, in quiet passages or with the level turned up.  You will have to work with settings to minimize this.  I retired this and use MyGica Ez Grabber 2, which has no sound issues.  I got this from a California online store for only a few dollars more than this device....do a google.  This device installs correctly off the bat...but it provides no level controls and the drivers do not run within other programs.  You must record within the provided applet.

Reviews.Title: The Item Simply Does Not Work with Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Ronny Gamboa Marin "R.M.G.M"
Reviews.Content: Does Not Work with Windows 7. That's all I have to Say.If I have read this somewhere I haven't bought it.Even when some people post some work-arounds.That is not the idea of a brand new item.

Reviews.Title: You'll need to find another software...
Reviews.Author: B. Guertin
Reviews.Content: The hardware works fine (so far) and it's worth it's price. Unfortunately, I can't install the software (Ulead Video Studio SE DVD) that comes with it. Contacted the Corel (who own Video Studio) and was "politely" told that they cannot help me as the software was obtained as an "included with hardware". If you choose to purchase this, make sure you obtain a proper video capturing software to go along with it.

Reviews.Title: didn't work
Reviews.Author: Jose-T
Reviews.Content: If you have windows vista, dont waste your time, I don't know if it works in windows xp cause I'm not willing to change my OS only cause this device, so I think I lost my money...

Reviews.Title: worth what you pay
Reviews.Author: Braden J. Crockett
Reviews.Content: Just like the other reviewers, this product was difficult for me to get set up. However, it does work after all your ducks are in a row. If you run Windows XP, the drivers that come with the CD are good, but if you have Vista, you need to go online and get the correct driver.Ulead software is horrible, but it was free. The other options are use something else that costs some money, or download just as awful free software.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 hours trying to get this thing to work even after reading the instructions left in other reviews. Rather than go through the headache, go work any job at minimum wage for 3 hours and buy something with much better quality for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: The product is as described
Reviews.Author: Rogers A. Pezoa
Reviews.Content: this is the only version of this hardware that I know of, which supports win 7. There are better softwares for capturing the video, I use it to watch sky in my computer.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the purpose
Reviews.Author: Chicago Hagop
Reviews.Content: It does exactly what it says.  Instead of using the included software, I used Roxio instead, same thing.  VHS movies transferred to DVD without problems, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Bad!!!
