Reviews.Title: Helpful!
Reviews.Author: Danno
Reviews.Content: Do not regard the negative... You just need to know computers and it all works just fine and very simple.

Reviews.Title: Awesome with patience!
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Cooper "RevReload"
Reviews.Content: I knew from the reviews if I could figure out how to make it work with my computer (vista) then it would be wonderful.  It took me two hours to figure out the right settings - and I couldn't tell you what I did.  But once I figured it out it has been a joy!  I love putting my old VHS tapes into digital format!

Reviews.Title: Nice product with just one flaw.
Reviews.Author: Gopi P. Sheth "New citizen"
Reviews.Content: I ordered my first Easy cap DC60 USB adapter(Software version 2.1c) and I did not have any issue. I used it with Windows XP SP3 on my laptop. The Driver installation looked like it hung but after 5 minutes, but I closed the task and it worked fine. Software  installation from cD worked just fine. No issue with video capturing and quality. Initially, the audio did not work. But, after  I changed the setting to get the input from USB, it worked  too. This is the first time I used this type of product and I am happy with it. I converted one of my old tapes with 13 years old Panasonic VCR and did not have any problem. The only issue is...it created 50 GB file for one tape..!! I just need to find out, how to compress it. Other than that, it worked really well. For the price I paid, I can't expect anything better.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rivero ".:DRH:."
Reviews.Content: It works as expected, the quality of the video is average with some difficulties during the setup of the software, but at the end it does what it's intended to do... Basic video recording, excellent to convert your old Betamax, VHS tapes. Ot works well on Windows 7

Reviews.Title: Typical Quality for the Price
Reviews.Author: video geek "you cant create digital quality f...
Reviews.Content: I have been doing video capture and conversion with multiple devices for several years. So based upon that experience, and some rather helpful reviews herein, I decided to give this device a try. I cant remark about other operating systems, as I am still a hold out using Windows XP Pro, service pack 3, but installation had no issues. I connected it to my VCR and had the device installed within minutes. But I do agree that the audio is less than desirable. I ended up connecting my VCR straight to the input on my computer's sound card. The software that comes with the device is your standard "free" package that comes with many capture devices these days. I have found that several open source products work as well or better. But all in all, for the price, the quality is pretty good, so I have ordered another one for my wife's computer.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Robert White
Reviews.Content: Works fine with Windows XP home and pro.  Not very good resolution, but you can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: EasyCap D60 Not so easy
Reviews.Author: J. Reach
Reviews.Content: Granted this is a low end device and the price reflects that, but my requirements were simple so I thought I'd give it a try.The Installation takes far too long because the software drivers provided with the device don't work, so considerable time was spend searching the web for the correct software. This alone makes a [...] buck device cost far more than the purchase price.Physical connectivity is easy (living up to its name there) but actually performing a capture takes way too much trial and error to get anything captured, let alone something that is of a good enough quality to keep.All in all, a piece of junk that will surely find its way to yard sale near you.If you really want to transfer those old VHS tapes or something similar, and simply want it to work, then you're better off opting for something considerably more expensive.

Reviews.Title: could not get it to work
Reviews.Author: Ron M.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product to transfer video from a VHS player to create a file capable of being burned to DVD via my Gateway laptop.  I was leary about the promises made for such a low price.  The product I received was made in China and the instructions were in broken English but I was able to install the software and connect the cables as shown.  However, I was not able to get any video signal through either the S-video connection or the RCA connection and after many hours of troubleshooting I finally got the video to work and the quality of the signal was absolutely horrible!  Not even useable.  You get what you pay for.  I will say the editing software that is included is pretty good, so I didn't totally throw money away.  To fulfill my need of burning high quality VHS video to DVD I purchased the Dazzle DVD Recorder Plus from Pinnacle and it works great!! I highly recommend this product, NOT the EasyCap.

Reviews.Title: Easycap for video games
Reviews.Author: Brennan R. Harris
Reviews.Content: There don't seem to be many reviews addressing the usefulness of the Easycap in playing video games on a computer monitor. I got an easycap for this purpose, since it is much cheaper than a VGA box. It works fine for this application. Latency is basically negligible. I had some trouble installing the software (note you must use the included software), but keep trying and you can get it to work. The software has a "preview" mode when you are capturing video; this is real-time and is how I play my games. It has a fullscreen mode, although the actual video does not fill the entire screen, but a good portion of it. Color, brightness, contrast, etc. might need to be adjusted but there are very good controls for these in the software and the settings save automatically. The resolution is certainly not HD, but text is legible, and there is no noticeable flickering or other artifacts. One thing that is probably not up to par for gaming is the audio; it is very hissy. That is easily fixed by simply buying an RCA to 1/8" adapter and plugging your speakers directly into this instead of the easycap. Overall, the product is reliable and, although it won't satisfy HD lovers, delivers a functional gaming experience on a PC monitor.

Reviews.Title: FOUND WAY TO WORK WITH VISTA AND WIN 7
Reviews.Author: Reo Lopez
Reviews.Content: ok first of all, im running on a windows vista 64 bit.the yellow cd that came with has the wrong drivers for me and many people that buy this, there is a driver that will make the quality beautiful, i still downloaded ulead video editor, so i can capture the easycap, i actualy like this software, some bugs for vista tho, i have to minumize and re bring up to make it refresh stuff like that.anyways im doing this review so you can get this to work, this driver is free.i made a youtube video so i can show you how to fix your easycap.my issue was no audio. this might fix any video issue your going thru aswellgo to youtube and search 1991oreo (my username)then go to my video labeled """""easyCAP audio fix (dc60 no "+")"""""dont know if amazon will remove the link but here it is:[...].subscribe to my youtube and comment saying it worked or if you have a question

Reviews.Title: Works!
Reviews.Author: Orland Penales "Allan"
Reviews.Content: For the price and a little bit of online research for the driver, works with my Win7. Does the job!

Reviews.Title: EasyCap video capture device
Reviews.Author: The Axeist
Reviews.Content: The capture software was fine and the device now works good.The primary issue (which is common for this particular model) is drivers.  The package was labeled "DC60" and the CD was labeled "DC60+"  The first problem I had with the driver was that the installation would abort because Windows XP was higher than Service Pack 2.  The manufacturer, [...] did not have any helpful support. Your vendor provided a zip file with the correct driver (STK1150) which installed but did not work.  I found an updated driver "STK1160" from a third party source (a link in a troubleshooting forum) prior to contacting the vendor and managed to get the device operational.

Reviews.Title: "pretty OK"
Reviews.Author: Mark "Mark"
Reviews.Content: I got this exact same product on eBay. I was able to use it to transfer a 1974 Vintage B&W; video from a Sony VCR to my hard disk on my desktop  XP computer, with out a hitch. I have owned a couple of Pinnacle products in the past which had similar capabilities, but they cost $100.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Andy "Andy"
Reviews.Content: My best advice is to not use the drivers provided. I was able to set this up easily with my Vista computer but XP was another story. I know you can do it but it would be a lot of hassle. If you are buying this for a console make sure you spend another $8 and get an S-Video cable to go with it. With S-Video and the right programs you can get it to look pretty damn good.

Reviews.Title: With a little labor you can get it to work
Reviews.Author: Anthony Stone "APS"
Reviews.Content: Here is  a review of this product...This is not plug & play as advertised as you will have to do some driver installing individually via your "device manager" before you can get it to work.what i did was first i installed the software, plugged in the device and the drivers won't install from the disc, so i had to download them from the site... once you have the drivers you save them to a directory marked drivers and then you have to do it manually from the device manager.For users on XP SP3 you will have to use the Vista 32 or 64 drivers [depending on your system] in  my emachine it doesn't run error free but it does work. just do a search on them! [the drivers]for audio problems, you may have to use a rca red/white patch cord adapter with the 3.5mm jack plugged in  from your audio out on the source [the red/white ends] and use the 3.5 plug into your mic/input jack. the sound from there sounds better than using the supplied built in audio driver as it has a humming or buzz sound to the audio. it will also depend on your soundcard but when i use the mic jack the sound records just as you would hear it through the speakers.Hope some will find the info useful? I spent all day trying to get this item to work, so I thought i would post about how I got it to work...you can also find some good videos on youtube that will help you! thats how I learned... maybe what I posted will save some the heartache of an allday task as i did?Now that I got it working it works great for its cheap price!

Reviews.Title: Simply doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Hugh A. Knowles "Skip"
Reviews.Content: When installed on three different computers the product would not work. A video signal of some kind was present but no camera imgage came through.

Reviews.Title: Unsopported gadget?
Reviews.Author: Plaza Marcelino
Reviews.Content: I purchased the gadget thinking it could be used to capture analogue sound material from LP's and tapes, not so much as video from betamax or vhs cassettes. I haven't been able so far to achieve that, the documentation that comes with the gadget is hopeless in that regard (as it also is, I'm temped to say, with anything else). So I went into the website advertised in the so-called "instructions" looking for technical support or for indications on how to get what I wanted (if such a thing was possible) only to be redirected to the website of a company called Corel, which seems to have absorbed the manufacturer as well as other companies. Well, their technical support team seem to have not the slightest idea on what I'm talking about as what they propose to has nothing to do with the question originally posed to them by me.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice little capture card!
Reviews.Author: ElBaha
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty nice little capture card, especially for USB. And for only $6, you really can't go wrong. I received this item within 3 days of purchasing(The estimated shipping was 5 days), and immediately went to test it. It works on both my laptop and my desktop(Windows Vista 32 bit), although my laptop doesn't record all that well(1.9Ghz dual-core processor), although it may be the graphics card as well. My dekstop is flawless with it.To get the best video quality!1.) Select the Video Studio Editor option upon starting the Ulead Studio2.) Click the capture tab, and then "Capture Video"3.) Don't start yet. Click the "options" gear, and select either the first or second option, I can't remember which.4.) Select AVI as your video footage, and set your compression to YUY2, not RGB. Make sure you have it set to the highest resolution.5.) Record! If you're wishing to record gameplay footage, this isn't good for low-end PC's. The video will turn out fine, but in the meantime you won't be able to see what you're doing.

Reviews.Title: Man What do you WANT for $7.99? Ya Cheapskates.
Reviews.Author: David C. Weddle "carroll6"
Reviews.Content: I got mine of of Ebay, for like $7.99 shipped.. don't remember the price, but it was dirt cheap.  Used it on XP with a old Pentium III.  Fired right up on ONE channel.  I used a Swann DIY cam.  Not bad.  As good as the cheap DVR PCI cards that I am also experimenting with.  In fact, the video was LESS jerky.  There is a lag in the video.  This night I tried hooking up two cams, this one a 30 LED chinese security cam.  For a long time I was pulling my hair.. didn't think the cam was working, even got a RMA to send it back.  THEN...I hooked it to the original channel, the #2 Channel that everyone says is the only one that works.  So I started scouring the net for forums with the same problem, and for drivers.  Here was my solution:  Each time you add a cam you have to reinitialize the device.  It makes sense, when you think of it.  You have to shut down, pull it out of the USB slot, and start it up again.  That is what worked for me.  Now the Video DOES lag a little bit.. but what do you want for 8 bucks?  This software is BETTER than the software I got on one of the PCI cards.  The lagging video, well I dunno.  The computer I am using is very old..I don't even know what it is.  Hmm.. a PIII I think.  So my verdict is:  It does the job.  With ONE cam it will do you very good.  AND..the price is right.  I give it 4 stars 'cos it does the job, is economical. You are not going to make movies with it, but it do the job.

Reviews.Title: Good Except for One Thing
Reviews.Author: Apostrophe
Reviews.Content: First off, installation went well (xp). The Ulead capture/ video editing software is pretty nice. You can adjust the picture e.g. brightness, etc.Great for regular home movies. You can cut and splice. all that.However, one of the reasons I got this was to transfer some old vhs tapes to dvd, something I've been meaning to do for a long time. I have stuff I taped off TV as long ago as the eighties, for example, most of a BBC?\PBS drama called "Private Shultz" (no, not sargeant shultz - not hogans heroes) that one just can't get in the US apparently. (this tape is really starting to go). Anyway, at the time I was taping I was unaware that VHS tapes degrade over time, how bad, depending on their quality rating. I never paid much attention, so ended up with a random mix with a lot of cheap tapes. Some of them have gotten pretty bad by now.I was surprised that first view of the EasyCap result looked clearer than the tape.Unfortuneately it kept getting a little too dark here and there and I found that had to keep adjusting. I also have some old sci-fi movies I actually bought. $40 plus back then for vhs movies (the rental concept was just starting out). They're starting to get fuzzy etc. too. Trying to copy one of them was much worse. Frequent, pretty much total, blackoutsI read an article about Macrovision copy protection on VHS tapes. They screw up the recorded signal somehow (on purpose). Apparently, a lot of older VCR's circuitry could compensate for the bad signal. Then, the studios or whatever got the government to pass a law that decreed player manufacturers to modify their devices to detect the pulses and screw up the picture. The only trouble is, it often can't tell the difference between a deteriorated recording and a macrovision signal. So I suspect that the circuits in the easyCap have been bent to conform to the anticopy mandate.It's not EasyCap's fault, but, a bit disappointing. Hence 4 stars out of 5.Still, you can't hardly go wrong for the price. A lot of bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: DONT GET IT!
Reviews.Author: James M. Morrison
Reviews.Content: I'm a computer savy kind of guy.  I thought what harm could it do?  I'll only be out 10 bucks if it sucks.  right...I installed the driver fine and then I thought I'd give there sofware a try, even though every one said use different software.  after I had to disable all my virus protection and my connection to the internet to install it.  I should have realized something was wrong.  then it asked to restart my computer for the changes to take effect.upon rebooting."hal.dll is missing or currupt"  windows would not start again, and I had to reinstall windows to fix the problem.if you have lots of time and like fixing problems this is a good product for you.

Reviews.Title: beware of vista
Reviews.Author: R. Butler "l1lDRUM3Rb0y"
Reviews.Content: i had issues installing it with vista but its do able. in all i enjoy the product. Its constructed well and records well

Reviews.Title: Not so Easy Capture
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Klepacz
Reviews.Content: For the price I'm surprise that it worked. However the drivers that came with the device did not work with Windows7 or Vista. You will have to search the web to get them. There is no manual for the software so you have to figure out how it works. The Ulead software now belongs to Corel and the version that comes with the hardware is several versions older that the actual. The capturing gives you a reasonable quality but don't expect miracles out of it.

Reviews.Title: Inadequate video and substandard audio.
Reviews.Author: Ray Wable "Ramon"
Reviews.Content: The Easy Cap60 is a substandared video capture device.  There is constant audio noise (static) and breaks in the audio.  The audio and video are out of sync.  After trying the device I trashed it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jason Pyatt
Reviews.Content: Great hardware. Having some issues with the cam not coming though the device. I don't know yet if this is due to the fact that I hvae an old spy cam or not. I will keep messing around with it to see if I can get the cam to stay working.

Reviews.Title: Video adapter
Reviews.Author: Dave "wolfe4656"
Reviews.Content: Unit works great, software alone is worth the value. Good unit records well and good quality.

Reviews.Title: I was skeptical
Reviews.Author: LL
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about the EasyCap but for a total of $17 I couldn't go wrong since others were listing for no less than $50+.  It came in just a few days and judging from the slightly cheezy packaging and especially the broken English (grammer syntax was hilarious) used in instructions, I was even more skeptical.  My first attempt at installation didn't work (wouldn't recognized the USB device).  I un-installed and re-installed and it started working.  Since then I've been capturing home movies made in the 60s with no problems; just hit play on the camera, and hit capture on the software and it works great!  Very happy with the software too.  I was able to enhance the video (which was a plus on these old videos), make different transitions, and add captions where ever I wanted.  Very happy!

Reviews.Title: It gets the job done.
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I purchased this about a month ago and I have to say, it gets the job done.  I have vista so the software it came with was a  pain to install but I eventually got it working(although I would recommend not using the capture software it comes with, instead use 'Debut video capture software professional'.  It is downloadable and works no problem on vista.)In other words, if you want some sort of HD-quality video capture, I would not recommend this.  I bought this to record gameplay on my Xbox 360.  Although it comes with an s video input, It will not let me capture s video(which is supposed to be very nice quality).  I'm stuck using the 3 AV inputs and it mediocre quality.  I'm sure that my s video troubles are just due to the fact that I have Vista on my computer, for which the easycap was not designed for.  So If you have XP, and are not looking for great video quality, I would say this would be right down your alley.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable for the price
Reviews.Author: javylsu
Reviews.Content: This thing is really easy to use, and the video quality is adjustable to whatever your needs are.  For $15, this is an UNBEATABLE deal.  I just needed a way to get saved programs off my DVR, and this did that task perfectly.  So much so that I was able to avoid buying a DVD burner I had planned on purchasing for this purchase.  Instead I hooked up my laptop to my DVR, recorded the programs, and saved them to my hard drive.  One of the best products I've ever bought.  Does its job, and at a great price.

Reviews.Title: A pain but well worth the effort
Reviews.Author: Brian D. Rogalski
Reviews.Content: Like many of the reviewers I had quite a pain setting this thing up. I was near the point of returning it when I finally got it right. There are definitely pros and cons for this item but in my opinion its the best capture card you can get for the money by far.Since we already mentioned the issues with setup I will start it off with the Cons.CONS:Installation and setup - it took me 3 solid days to actually get this working the right way.Durability - the casing is quite cheap. In fact it was lightly bumped while plugged into my computer and the housing split. I was able to get it put back together but the usb adapter is still slightly bent.Software - The software that mine came with didnt have the serial. After getting a serial there are a couple minor flaws with it but nothing you can't work around.PROS:Quality - EXCELLENT video and sound quality. I figured that I would get a cheapo capture device to record my PS3 games. What I didn't know is that the quality would be so superb. I've watched hundred or thousands of video game captures and many are quite blurry and unrecognizeable. This however is crystal clear.Ease of use - Once you have this set up with the software its just one click to record and one click to stop recording.Size - Compact and quite ready to travel.Cost - As I mentioned before I was looking for something cheap but this product if made a little more user friendly could be at the top of the market.

Reviews.Title: worked fine
Reviews.Author: Joel Coyne
Reviews.Content: The directions from the company are worthless but  the directions written in other reviews some were very useful.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD
Reviews.Author: Lakers "FE"
Reviews.Content: Its works good, but if ur not a techie it maybe be hard to setup. It can record in various formats. CE Compass was the company i used and they shipped it real FAST.EDIT: I finally really tried it and it works good except sometimes the picture in the video looks like it fades when in the video to be recorded there is a lot of movement.

Reviews.Title: USB Video capture adaptor
Reviews.Author: kane
Reviews.Content: After capturing video with this device, there is a high pitched whine that comes through the speakers and no other audio. This happens both during capture, and afterwards when the video is played back. I tried more than one device and the same problem persists. Video with whining and no audio except whining. I suppose there could be some chance that the problem is with my computer, but I have no way of testing for this. I also tried both the video capture software that comes with the device, and Roxio that I already have on my computer. It made no difference.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the Price
Reviews.Author: Manick
Reviews.Content: Great little product for the price. I bought it to connect an imaging device with a CVBS output to a laptop. Worked straight out of the box once the drivers were installed on a VISTA home OS. The device is now seen  as a webcam which is exactly what I was trying to achieve.

Reviews.Title: It took too long to get here (Mpls., MN)
Reviews.Author: Sam Clemens
Reviews.Content: And by the time it arrived (ship date+time to arrival) they wouldn't accept a return. It wasn't what I needed. But it was cheap.

Reviews.Title: Easy_Cap DC-60
Reviews.Author: Bruce J. Bitney
Reviews.Content: Other than finding a driver to work with Windows 7, had no problems copying VCR tapes to my computer.

Reviews.Title: Polar Cap
Reviews.Author: Rondahl Mitchell "media mogul"
Reviews.Content: I had to take the time to submit my review about this product. First of all the drivers only work with windows XP-98 & 2000 as far as those of us who have upgraded to windows 7 32-64 bit operating systems this is not the item you want to buy. Windows 7 and Vista does not allow the driver to operate. It will give you a message that it cannot find a compatible driver for this unit. It will however work with windows XP and does an adequate job. I recently ordered the ION USB video capture device which by far gives you the quality and functionality you need for any version and transferes tapes and DVD's affortlessly. I really needed the easycap to work because I was behind on clients projects after the easycap didn't work. I tried the dazzel and another transfer device that just didn't give me the clear video and audio quality I needed. Don't go cheap save $50 bucks and get the ION you will rest easier knowing that you have a product that you can count on. bottom line easycap is really Polarcap cause it will leave you cold.

Reviews.Title: Bummer
Reviews.Author: sumguy "sumguy"
Reviews.Content: Drivers installed correctly, but only one frame of broken video received every 5 or 10 seconds on a fairly fast PC.  Followed advice on settings and did some web research.  Maybe mine was defective

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: J. G. MATHIESON "CA tech lover"
Reviews.Content: I guess you get what you pay for. After several hours I tossed this and bought an Elgato.The drivers appeared to install correctly, the device was recognized, I could configure it... but nothing ever came through. The video would show up as some yellow lines that jumped occasionally. I re-booted, re-installed, took out the USB extender and plugged it in directly, all to no avail.Then I tried this on my Mac, using the open source driver (google it). Everything worked immediately, except there was no sound. Turns out there has been an update to this product, and the new sound HW is not recognized by Macs. Boo!Perhaps you'll get lucky with the drivers, perhaps not. As I said, you get what you pay for. Unless you want to take the risk of the driver install game of roulette, spend a bit more and get something from a reputable manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Video works, audio does not
Reviews.Author: Ralph Stamerjohn
Reviews.Content: I bought this to move my VHS tapes to disk.I got video to work out of the box on my Windows 7 system (I think update the drivers, its been 6 weeks). I use 740x480 at highest quality and the highest frame rate (9500 for me).Audio through the EasyCap never worked - way to much ugly background noise. After a month of playing around, I read from someone else to run the audio through the microphone jack. All is now well.

Reviews.Title: Works but a few questions
Reviews.Author: go-digital "go-digital"
Reviews.Content: After much skepticism I went ahead with the purchase and have to say that it is a little beauty. I mean for juts 15 bucks it is a mighty full piece of equipment. I does what it says and thanks to comments for users like 'Loving Christian', I was able to get it to capture video/audio in no time.However, there are a few issues. I am running Vista at 32 bit so that was not a problem. But when I change to MPEG, like suggested to get best quality, it does not see the capture device and gives me a message to the effect of that it does not recognize the input/source, or something like that. Moreover, I was not able to see the quality slider, which was mentioned to be set to FULL quality.Another problem is that I captured some clips and I can see them on top right as video icons. I can even click on them and play them in the main window. But when I try to drag them down to my project timeline, it says the content of this file is unreadable, even though it was captured using this device. I am sure it is somekind of setting somewhere, but would appreciate some help here.thanks.

Reviews.Title: I Neep Help with This
Reviews.Author: A. Lyon "cam"
Reviews.Content: Hey everyone. I recently bought this product to upload videos from my canon DV camera to my Windows XP computer. I didn't even bother to upload the editing software that came with the device because I like the simplicity of Windows Movie Maker. So I installed the driver, and clicked capture from device on Movie Maker. When the window comes up with the preview screen, a just get a frozen, colorless, distorted image of the image on my camera lcd screen. I guess this means that the device is sending the display of whats in my camera to the computer, but i just can't save/record any videos on to my computer. If anyone has a solution to this problem or any contact information for the company, please email me at Clyon108@gmail.com. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Crap.  Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: This thing is a piece of crap.  First, the audio always sounds scratchy and horrible quality.  I have tried it on separate computers, read the forums online, but I am sure nothing can fix it.  I am an IT Professional, and I have lots of experience troubleshooting devices, but none of them have been as bad as this.  The video works fine WHEN it works.  That is seldom in my cases.  Even when I switch it to NTSC via Control Panel, Scanners and Cameras, it does not always work.  Clicking it over and over sometimes fixes it.  The video editing software included freezes my computer every time so much that I have to restart.Do not buy this for any reason, no matter how easy it seems to use.  It is a piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: When being cheap is necessary
Reviews.Author: LexAeterna
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. You will not be making HD YouTube videos with this capture card and I probably wouldn't advise using this to convert your VHS to DVD or any other digital format. This is mainly because the picture quality on this capture card is a joke. You would get better picture quality on an old CRT TV. However, if you're like me and had your TV break suddenly out of the blue and you need a quick fix of videogames and don't want to bust out three figures on a proper HD video capture device or your computer simply can't handle cards like that, then this is the capture card for you.Pros:-Let's you play console videogames on your computer.-CheapCons:-Poor video quality.-NO SOUND (this can be fixed with more cables and a pair of headphones/speakers. There's good videos on Youtube about this)

Reviews.Title: BE AWARE!
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the EasyCap because my other capture device broke. When I received the EasyCap, the plastic packaging had been cut through in various places, and the CD that was included (the CD containing the drivers and editing software) was completely scratched. Keep in mind that this item was purchased as "New" or so it claimed to be. Anyway, I highly recommend NOT buying this trash EasyCap. Most likely you will spend $10+ on something that doesn't even work. However, I recommend purchasing the Diamond VC500 instead. The Diamond VC500 is not much more expensive than the EasyCap, and It actually works! The Diamond VC500 also has the same, if not better, video editing software than the EasyCap. I read the EasyCap product features and it said that it uses Ulead software which is the same as the Diamond VC500 editing software.

Reviews.Title: Worest ever
Reviews.Author: Osman
Reviews.Content: uselessnot workingand very cheap made.. it never work with any windows i tried with XP or 7 still not workingdont lose ur money buying it..

Reviews.Title: Computer Crashes!!!!!
Reviews.Author: MarkL
Reviews.Content: This may be the worst purchase I have ever made online, with the only positive factor being that it was relatively cheap.  However even if it were free, it wouldn't be worth it because it doesn't work.  Furthermore, it causes my computer to crash and gives the "blue screen of death".  I have installed the software on 3 different computers, with different operating systems (all compatible with the device supposedly) and had the same result each time, CRASH!!!.  I do not recommend this device at all.  I need a device of this nature, but this isn't going to cut it.  If anyone has a better device for copying from a Dish DVR to. Laptop, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: 1 TRUE PIECE OF CRAP
Reviews.Author: jiji4jrjh6lrijt
Reviews.Content: HI THIS THING SUCKS. I WANTED TO USE IT FOR MAKING COMMENTARYS ON YOUTUBE ([...]) IT WORKS BUT SO HARD TO SETUP. ITS TOOK MY ALL DAY TO SET IT UP. AND IT DOESNT WORK ON WINDOWS 7

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with XP SP3 or Win 7 64 bit
Reviews.Author: Aliron
Reviews.Content: Tried various drivers and installation methods from the internet and the installation CD, and none of them worked for my XP SP3 laptop or my Win 7 64bit desktop.  According to numerous sources, the original "EasyCap" makers are now called "EzCap" and new products retaining the "EasyCap" name are most likely unlicensed reproductions.  The casing might appear to be the same, but the chipsets are different, even amongst the reproductions.  The people who have gotten them working probably received a chipset that functions in newer Windows OSes, while the rest of us received chipsets that don't.I shipped this product back for a refund today.  Save yourself the frustration if you are running a newer version of Windows, and just spend a bit more money for a real product.

Reviews.Title: CAPTURE VIDEO ON ANYTHING
Reviews.Author: Jeffery L. Copeland
Reviews.Content: I use it with tiny bird house cameras and watch my yard on my tv's!! Kind of like a full blown security system without the EXPENSE of one. Great for my front door security and driveway entrance gate. Ck out the camera used by Charley's mom's on 2&1/2 men. That is how I connect this video to my tv from my front door or other. VERY easy to install and start viewing and recording all activity around my house outside. GREAT no nonsense hookup! You only get what you need to do the job!! Not a big bunch of wires and other stuff like a real security system! I am doing the same thing with alot less since I found this easycap and go strait into my computer and my tv.

Reviews.Title: FILED CLAIM
Reviews.Author: Walter C. Lueck
Reviews.Content: It caused my computer to reboot.....so I sent it back....I have emailed them at least 2 times , but have heard nothing.  So I have filed a claim, and have also have heard nothing.

Reviews.Title: Non-starter
Reviews.Author: Jack Frost
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get this device to work at all. In the process the case snapped apart and I couldn't get it back together so I couldn't return it. A waste of my money.

Reviews.Title: Will not work for Windows Vista-64 bit Operating systems
Reviews.Author: J. Kim "HonestReviews"
Reviews.Content: I just found out from the company's website [...] that this will not work with Windows Vista 64-bit systems...which is why I wasted several hours trying to install the driver for this thing.  Also, the usb extension adapter did not fit with the usb plug on the device and it broke when I tried to put it in, so I had to toss the usb extension anyways. I won't buy another cheap product like this.  The package says it works with Windows Vista...but they don't specify it's the 32-bit OS.  Make sure you know which OS you have and don't buy it if you have the 64-bit OS.

Reviews.Title: Installation a little annoying, but overall a good deal.
Reviews.Author: E. Mclaurin
Reviews.Content: I figured even if this didn't work, it'd be worth the money to try and I was surprised by how easy it was to install and use. You need to install the drivers before you attach the device, but the installation was pretty simple. I occasionally have to restart the software to get it to recognize the device, but the software runs well and is fairly user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great - Does its job once you have the right drivers
Reviews.Author: Path To Wisdom
Reviews.Content: Got this installed on 2 laptops and one desktop, all XP.So, if you have a problem getting it to work, you either have amalfunctioning unit, or you don't know what you are doing,or you didn't follow the instructions. See instructions from other reviewers.Forgot where I got my drivers from in the internet.I think the drivers from the provided CD works.But I misplaced it and have to find it again on the internetwhen I have to reinstall xp.Whenever I used a different USB port, the computer wants to reinstall thedrivers.  What a pain.......The 2 free softwares (Debut and Golden Video) from NCH recommended by another reviewer was very good.[...]No I don't work for this company, and they don't pay me to write about them.I had trouble with getting sound from this device when using movie maker.Now with Debut of NCHsoftware, I have no problem converting VCR tapes to DVD.And I can save as MPEG, which uses less bytes than AVI from movie maker.It is as cheap as it comes. Don't expect High Definition quality.But quality was degraded  from the better quality from the tape.The darker the image, the worse it became. The software "Debut" includedadjustments to brightness, and contrast, but not saturation.So, if the picture was not from good day light, you have a problem with theimage not being great. Oh, I was talking about personal recordings.

Reviews.Title: DC60 will not work on Mac OS X
Reviews.Author: S. Sahyun
Reviews.Content: Vendor HDE shipped product promptly so I have no complaints with the vendor or the price. But the item is model DC60 which will not work on a Mac. Apparently the EasyCap009 or EasyCap DC60+ can work with a Mac if you use the VideoGlide software [...] from [...], but this one will not work.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing!
Reviews.Author: James Anthony "James Anthony"
Reviews.Content: This thing records very well for its price!as you can see in my video,its capable of recording amazing footage!just be sure your ready to do some learning when it comes to what settings are the best for you.if you want to record your gameplay,then i advise you to get this product!!

Reviews.Title: but it B*tch's, great!!
Reviews.Author: Edgar H. Castro
Reviews.Content: i like it, it took me a while to set it up, but once u install it just go to options change inputs to s cables or the color av;s cables both work the same, the video quality is ok its no blue ray but decent enough for home videos!! not production lol :P i like it ummmmmm buy buy bye!!!

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Juan M. Hoffmann "Toscano"
Reviews.Content: Bought with great hope, small price. But severly dissapointed, couldn't make a single copy of any VHS, trying all the recommendations on the enclosed guide. I have an IBM T 42 with windows XP professional.Impossible to get to show anything on the window that opens when connected, no audio. Tested with different computers.When ending it starts making a menu witch doesn't end ,much longer then the time of recording- it has to be stopped by interrupting the whole computer,sorry, be aware and test it so to be able to return it. I live in Aregentina and can't go back to the store or send it back because of the shipping cost

Reviews.Title: S video wanted
Reviews.Author: Bulindperomari
Reviews.Content: I haven't been able to set it up yet I need  s video if anyone can help out if really aperctiate it :)

Reviews.Title: Sucks Dck
Reviews.Author: Luz Celis Navarro
Reviews.Content: Doesnt recored. Only lets me se then xbox screen. Really bad resolution do not buy these is a rip off

Reviews.Title: ended up not needing it
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I ended up not needing it after all, but it did take for ever to come in but I ended up keeping it anyway

Reviews.Title: Review for those gamers
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: If you are using this for game play or any of that stuff save your money and buy something else Youtube or whatever isn't going any where anytime soon. Also its 8 dollars for a reason.

Reviews.Title: Some slight issue but...
Reviews.Author: A Pudgy Pug
Reviews.Content: Well it DOES work and it required some patience for me to get it to work on a windows 7 operating system since most newbies here (because I can tell) rather put a flame to the seller and product than trying to get to their goal. Like I said, it works and requires patience. The downfall is that I can't get any audio, I'm pretty sure some do get the same issue but until I find the culprit, I will comeback and update my review to help you newbs.

Reviews.Title: So-so
Reviews.Author: Khelek
Reviews.Content: Works ok when set-up, but the process is difficult and requires going online to find the approproate software. Quality is sub-par. I recommend spending more that this. That being said, it's worth what it's worth.

Reviews.Title: xbox
Reviews.Author: kermit
Reviews.Content: Does it work to record Xbox 360 gameplay? and if so do i need the AV cables and the male/female adapter?

Reviews.Title: Keep shopping
Reviews.Author: ichedo
Reviews.Content: So I WAS all exciting about being able to use this dongle to run a real video camera instead of the crummy web cam I have. I cut off the plastic container, read the quick start guide and did exactly as it said, Install the software first. I'm running windows XP SP3 on a self made desktop. Well it gave me a warning, saying the software has not been verified and may cause issues. Like a total lug nut, I charge ahead, install the software, plug in the dongle, and it works. Problem is, my normal shut down procedure no longer worked, nor my sleep mode, or log off. I had to hold the power button down to shut off. After a week of doing this, I decided to uninstall and use it on my laptop. I uninstall and the problem doesn't go away. I had to use a restore point two weeks prior to fix it. Frustrated, I let it set a few days, before trying it on the laptop, unfortunatly misplacing the CD. OK, internet software driver search time. NOTHING!! I can't find the proper software anywhere. I can't find costomer support either. I tried some software from a simular dongle, and NOPE AGAIN. Time for the junk pile.

Reviews.Title: Weak
Reviews.Author: Gun buyer
Reviews.Content: my easycap worked on vista but i couldnt here sound when i was playing on it and my friend unplug it by accident and it stoped working get a different product

Reviews.Title: Lets get real...
Reviews.Author: Brandon J.
Reviews.Content: Lets get real... If you're paying $15 for a capture card, you really shouldn't expect much.  That being said, this capture card is not in HD, does not have good quality, and feels quite cheap.  But seriously, it's a $15 capture card and it does what it's supposed to do.  Don't expect a technological masterpiece, but this item captures video in standard def no problem.

Reviews.Title: This works awful.
Reviews.Author: Aaran
Reviews.Content: I asked my dad if he could buy me a Sabrent Audio/Video Capture Device. Instead I get this piece of crap. Its so crappy, I'm not using its name. One day, I was on Youtube, and I wanted to make videos of my own. This junk has a LOT of lag, the sound is messed up and distorted, looks awful, and is very much just useless. The device itself is broken. It falls apart very easily. If you want to be disappointed by this, then buy it. If not, get something that has more positive reception than negative reception, and SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Thing Ever
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I ordered my easyCap a couple months back. I use it to record mostly xbox gameplay. It works great! The recording system is kinda bad but if you look on youtube about how to set the settings the video quality goes way up. Also you should save your finished movie in 1080x720 for best end quality. If you want to see how mine turned out check me out on youtube;  Patar218  If you have any questions about how to get good quallity just send me a message on youtube.

Reviews.Title: heres the deal
Reviews.Author: Jayme Folkes
Reviews.Content: It works as far as video for me . The unit itself , the audio is non existent  BUT , I was able to get an audio connection with an audio cable via my line in source on the pc . Other than the audio snaffu , it works great . The picture quality is great , not hd but as good as the source. I  was pleased with my purchase , and recommended  it to a few friends . Well worth the money .

Reviews.Title: Fake version of EzCap
Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: Save your money and buy the authentic EzCap and not this generic fake.  Mine will not work even after hours of installing and uninstalling.  I've upgraded drivers for both the Ulead software and the EasyCap with no success.  The software works with my USB webcam, but not while using the EasyCap adapter.I just placed my order for the 'real' EzCap116.

Reviews.Title: Really bad video and sound quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Installing driver is difficult for Win7 64bit (as described by others). But even with the correct drivers installed, both sound and video quality is really bad. The sound can be improved by tweaking it in the mixer but even than it is not good. The video has stripes. I spent quite a bit of time trying to tweak the setting to get good quality but without success. Bought a similar product (EZgrabber2) for about $25 and it worked instantly (no problem installing driver and no tweaking). Thus I don't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: WORTHLESS GARBAGE
Reviews.Author: JADE
Reviews.Content: I've had an EZ Grabber for the past 2 yrs and the unit broke recently after 100's of hrs of use.  I download a lot of TV shows, talk shows & soap operas as well as VHS to DVD conversions.  Though disappointed the unit no longer works right, I must say I definitely got my money's worth when I bought it for about $35 back then.  So when I saw this EasyCap USB video capture device for such a rock bottom price of less than $8, I thought why not? Maybe it was so cheap because of how electronic devices always fall in price the longer they are sold.  No...the reason for the cheap price is that this was a worthless piece of garbage.  The audio was horrible & scratchy and when I got on the net & Youtube to figure out a way to fix it, I found that lots of people all have the same complaints about it.  Many also say that unit stopped working only after a couple of uses.  Another lesson learned of "You get what you pay for".  I chucking this EasyCap into the garbage can and just order another EZ Grabber.  You can tell it was a bad experience right off the bat.  the EZ Grabber came with virtually no instructions.  Just the installation disk which made me nervous.  However, have no fear, just plug & play and it works beautifully right out of the bag.  The EasyCap came with 2 pages of instructions.  None of it helped me.  Just Junk!

Reviews.Title: if I knew
Reviews.Author: Ben Cheseldine
Reviews.Content: The professional status of this company for my return was great.  I needed a mac compatable cord and this wasn't it.  It was refunded in full as quickly as it was charged

Reviews.Title: Own Windows 7? Buy a different item!
Reviews.Author: zeus2zeus
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews prior to purchasing this capture device and understood that this was probably a gamble, but decided to roll the dice anyway due it's very affordable price. Well, that backfired! I own a 64-bit edition of Windows 7 and following much reading, downloaded 64-bit drivers to ensure that this device would install properly with my computer. And it did, or at least seemed to, and so did the provided software. However, once I actually attempted to capture some video (an old program on VHS via a still viable VCR), I encountered a problem that many, many others have while using this product: no audio. In other words, the video captured fine, but the audio did not. So, unless you're attempting to capture footage without audio, you can see how this might be problematic. I spent roughly 5 hours searching forums, reinstalling drivers, trying this and that, and never resolved the audio problem. Be aware that this audio issue is very widespread, and if you experience it, a resolution is nearly impossible to find. So, if the temptation exists to take a chance on this product due only to it's price, try to resist and save yourself some unnecessary headaches.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: F. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Works great. Comes with the EasyCap and the CD to install driver and Ulead Video Software. Everything worked great on my Windows Vista 64 Bit. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: THIS DEVICE IS NOT WORKING
Reviews.Author: Moises Rosales
Reviews.Content: I  TESTED THIS DEVICE IN THREE DIFFERENT COMPUTERS AND NO WORK,THIS DEVICE IS CURRENTLY IN THE POT OF GARBAGE

Reviews.Title: It works....sorta
Reviews.Author: Henry Dickson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this device with the intention of makeing montage video's off of video game systems and all I can say was that it works after a 30 to 40 problems that range from the software haveing to be installed multiple times for the "capture software" to work and then after finaly geting the thing to work I got no sound at all. Yes I did fiddle with every seting possible and it dose receve a signal as the computer dose register it.  So I ignored that and bought a few y adapters to add an addion of being able to hear it through a set of headphones. Ok so the sound issue was resoulved, got a video feed, so now to capture.....right....no saddly every time I would record with it the screen resulution down graded but I'll go with it it was only 10$... let it record for 10 min....all I got was a screen shot that was curupted and trashed audio that ould make your ears bleed.  So I played with eveery setting possible to pritty much get the same ressult so I used Adobe Premiere to capture thinking that the cheap tag on software was crapply codded well the same result came about when adobe captured the footage except this time there was audio but the footage was like watching a bad tv signal for tv channels that you could order back in the day.  All I can say is if you want to use your laptop or desktop to play games on ( keep in mind that the screen is 320 x 200 at best) other wise run away...run away as fast as you can from this barggin bin pile of tecno crap.

Reviews.Title: Does not work with Vista 64
Reviews.Author: Neil D'andria "Neil James"
Reviews.Content: I was lead to believe from the information upon purchase that this would have worked with Vista.  Come to find out it does not.  Worked great on my XP machine but that was not what I had intended.

Reviews.Title: Device works, software does not.
Reviews.Author: M. Stevens "Paradoxicon"
Reviews.Content: It does allow me to view TV on my computer, but if you try to record anything longer that 5 minutes it locks up. I wanted to use it to record hour long TV shows, but no go. I mean how hard can that be?

Reviews.Title: Don't Fall For The Low Price
Reviews.Author: CWETHIN "CMW"
Reviews.Content: I too thought I would take a chance on this low cost item - worked semi-successfully ONCE.  Now my computer does not recognize the device even after uninstalling and reinstalling the drivers.

Reviews.Title: Too much trouble
Reviews.Author: xander03
Reviews.Content: ok, well i was hoping to use this to play video games on my computer, so i just wanted the preview portion of it. well, the drivers dont work on the cd. and i tried looking all over the internet for the drivers for the program so it would show up in the dvd suite program it comes up with.  eventually, i was able to get the video to work but couldnt get the audio to work.  today, i was doing research on how to get that to work and you really have to mingle within the program data for the driver and stuff. even after that it didnt work. so i have officially given up.  i really suggest on doing your research on a different product than this because its really complicated to get it to work and such.  i have some knowledge about how a computer works and stuff, but the knowledge to figure out how this thing works is way beyond me. like i said before, do research for a different product that actually works. just because it is cheap doesnt make it the best product out there.

Reviews.Title: good but not great.
Reviews.Author: Justin N. Williams
Reviews.Content: Although it functions, it did not meet my expectations. Only captures in 760X480, and that's the highest it goes. If you're looking for a true HD capture card, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Did Not Work For My Needs as a webcam
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The only thing this device 'captured' for me was cash out of my wallet.  It seems most people having success with it are recording to DVD or something.  I needed the device to act as a webcam for recording live performances for UStream.  Needless to say, I have yet to find an inexpensive device that will do that for me and this is not one of them.  Currently still resigned to using one basic webcam, instead of a very nice camera with video/s-video outputs.  I did not bother trying to get another one and it could have just been that I got a dud.

Reviews.Title: waste of time
Reviews.Author: Mislead
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews i decided to give this product a try! The setup was fairly easy....only problem is....NO ONE MENTIONED THAT OTHER PIECES ARE NEEDED TO CAPTURE VIDS FROM CAMCORDERS TO COMPUTERS!!!! All this time i was lead to believe if you plug this thing in to all the correct ports it would do what its supposed to do....turns out (according to all the youtube vids i watched trying to figure this thing out) its really only useful if you still own a vcr or if you want to record your video games from an xbox, wii, ps3 WHATEVER (who would want to do that anyway????) So basically it was a waste of my money but not because it didn't work at all....the quality of the product seems decent and it arrived very quickly....BUT IF YOU HAVE A CAMCORDER GIVE UP BECAUSE THIS PRODUCT IS NOT FOR YOU....

Reviews.Title: Here is how I got it to work....
Reviews.Author: Yours Truly
Reviews.Content: Hello All:I have a security DVR which gives me direct AVI extracts out of its USB port, but without audio. So my project was to find a way to video capture extracts from the DVR. I bought this EasyCap. Had to make several passes with the WinXP driver install routines until all of EasyCap's drivers installed. Then I installed their video capture software. I was able to get sound but only got fuzz in the video display panel. Then tried Win XPs Movie Maker. Same thing albeit more frustrating. Movie Maker would lock up after each attempt. Next, I went out on a video capture software hunt and tried several other products which had trial downloads. No luck and I was almost at my wits end. My last stop happened to be nchsoftware, who offer the Debut video capture software. And the basic version is free.Unbelieveably, after a little bit of fudging, the video feed from my dvr showed up in the Debut display on my pc. This amazing software lets you record in any of multiple formats: vcd, avi, mp4, etc. There are a couple of quirks, not so huge though. One is that in the 'tools' options to adjust the device I have to keep changing the video input format to NTSC_M each time I launch Debut. Culprit is EasyCap which keeps defaulting to PAL_B. Not sure why PAL_B was chosen as default while marketing to the US. Secondly, while recording I can see the green audio bar moving in the Debut display panel but cannot hear the audio.After I 'stop' the recording session and replay the newly created file from 'recordings' on the menu I have both video and sound in the file.Hope this information will help you too. Saved my day. And I recommend a robust donation to nch software for the free version of Debut. Alternately, buy the Debut Plus to support the company. They have a huge line of other video related products.Hope this info helps you and good luck.AhmedUSA

Reviews.Title: Not worth it even for the software
Reviews.Author: M. GOLDMAN "MG"
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there is a good reason for buying this product but the ones I had didn't have a chance.  The install was a little to "much" for a product like this.  The software kept asking for a channel for the video feed.  So it seemed to me that one product really didn't know about the other.If someone gets this to work to their satisfaction, please post a note for the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: Virus alert
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: When loading the software, a virus warning poped up. Note, I then ran my spyware etc and it did not show anything, but I will Not risk the possibility of some hidden attachment.

Reviews.Title: Easy CAP is a great product an very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Scotty Veilleux
Reviews.Content: With my Easy Cap, I record my Xbox 360 gameplay in HD to YouTube. This product is great, and is very inexpensive which is great. I know people with the Dazzle, and when I compared that quality to EasyCAP, my quality was way better than the Dazzle. You just have to use the right settings and it will look great with no lag, or choppy video. It also always has the audio in sync with the video. I have had few problems, which I solved within half an hour. Here is a tip; When recording with Ulead, make sure Ulead is the only program opened at the time to reduce the risk of having choppy videos. And use a frame rate of 6000. BUY EASYCAP IT'S GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy Easycrap!
Reviews.Author: Jonny Jon Jones
Reviews.Content: The Easycrap device, the software disc and the instructions you can toss in the trash...doesn't work. Keep the usb extension cable and take care of it, works like a charm. Pay $20 or whatever you're paying for the video capture package and you will be paying $20 for a Dollar General quality usb extension cable no longer than about 2 feet in length. The only EASYCAP device is the usb extension cable, very easy to usb, no instuctions or software needed, no margin for error, just plug it in! Don't waste $20 on a 2ft. long easycap usb extension cable. If you look around just a little harder I'm sure you could find one. Better yet if you ask someone nicely they would probably give you one! The absolute truth...this Easycrap does not work at all! It is not compatible with Windows XP even though my PC is three times the so called system requirements of the Easycrap software. You can try all day long to install the drivers for this Easycrap device whether it's the software disc that comes with it or download it online, it absolutely will not install. You can forget about a refund from the crook that sold you the Easycrap, you won't get it. You can also forget about things like updates, rolling back the driver, help, support and positive suggestions...there are none. I've been there and done that, now I'm warning you because I hate to see people waste their hard to earn money. I also sell products to people but only if it works. I would never be dishonest, selling people things that I know don't work. I really don't see how there could be more positive than negative customer reviews for this Easycrap device..they all should be negative with zero stars. I have been ripped off by buying two of these Easycrap devices. Nothing to do now but throw the Easycraps in the garbage where they belong and warn others. My suggestion, if you want a descent video capture device or one that just works just spend a little extra money.
